story:
**Hebrew follows עברית בהמשך**

What?

“Cartoon Criticism Care” competition* is going global!

*​The  "Cartoon Criticism Care" competition was launched in Israel in 2015, following the terrorist attack on the Charlie Hebdo magazine. The competition gives teenagers an opportunity to artistically express their opinion while considering their audience's feelings. 

Who?

Youth around the world. 

Why?

Promoting creativity and freedom of expression of teenagers around the world!

When?

The 2018-2019 global competition will open on September 2018.

How?

Raising the funds needed with your help!

The expenses of a global competition include:  global marketing and online media strategy,  exhibition in Jerusalem and worldwide, prizes for the winners and more - see details below.

How can you support us?

>> Choose your favorite perk from the wide selection of creative gifts we are offering!

>> Share the campaign among your friends, colleagues and family members!

 

Please notice that the campaign is a “fixed-funding”, meaning we could get the funds only if we reach our goal (otherwise supporters will be refunded).

Every support, large or small, will get us one step closer to reaching our goal!

Thank you for supporting us!

The JPC team
 

The Jerusalem Press Club

The Cartoon Criticism Care competition was launched by the Jerusalem Press Club, a professional social club for the foreign press based in Israel and those visiting it. Since its establishment, the JPC has put together dozens of successful programs for the foreign press based in Israel and in addition for groups of specialized journalists covering a variety of areas such as: science, high tech, film etc. JPC is member of the International Association of Press Clubs and the Federation of European Press Clubs.

 

 


 

מה?

תחרות הקריקטורות "מאיירים, מבקרים, מתחשבים" * יוצאת אל העולם!

*את תחרות הקריקטורות "מאיירים, מבקרים, מתחשבים" השקנו ב-7 בינואר 2015, יום השנה הראשון למתקפת הטרור על המגזין הצרפתי "שרלי הבדו." התחרות מאפשרת לבני נוער לבטא את עצמם בצורה אמנותית תוך גילוי התחשבות ברגשות קהליהם. 

מי?

בני נוער ברחבי העולם!

למה?

קידום חופש הביטוי בקרב בני נוער ברחבי העולם!

מתי?

התחרות הבין לאומית תפתח בספטמבר 2018.

איך?

אנחנו מגייסים את המשאבים הנדרשים בעזרתכם!

ההוצאות הבסיסיות של תחרות גלובלית כוללות שיווק בין לאומי ואסטרטגיית אונליין מדיה, פרסים לזוכים, פתיחת התערוכה בירושלים וברחבי העולם ועוד - ראו פירוט למטה.

איך תוכלו לתמוך בנו?

>> בחרו את המתנה המועדפת עליכם מבין המגוון הרחב של המוצרים שיצרנו, כולל הקריקטורות של

המשתתפים מהתחרויות הקודמות!

>> שתפו את הקמפיין עם חברים, קולגות ובני משפחה!

 

שימו לב כי הקמפיין הוא בתצורת "fixed-funding", משמעות הדבר שנוכל לקבל את המימון רק אם נגייס את הסכום במלואו (אחרת אתם התומכים תקבלו החזר כספי).

כל תמיכה, קטנה או גדולה, תאפשר לנו להתקדם בצעד אחד קרוב יותר להשגת המטרה שלנו!

תודה על תמיכתם!

צוות מועדון העיתונאים

 

מועדון העיתונאים ירושלים (The Jerusalem Press Club – JPC)

תחרות הקריקטורות "מאיירים מבקרים מתחשבים" הושקה על ידי מועדון העיתונאים ירושלים, שנוסד על ידי הקרן לירושלים במטרה לשמש כמרכז מקצועי וחברתי עבור העיתונאים הזרים המוצבים בישראל ואלה המבקרים בה. מאז הקמתו ב-2013, מקיים המועדון פעילויות מגוונות סדירות וכן מארח קבוצות עיתונאים מחו"ל המכסים תחומים כמו היי-טק, מדע, תרבות ועוד. המועדון חבר בארגון הבינלאומי של מועדוני העיתונות ובפדרציה של מועדוני העיתונות האירופאים.

 

 

This campaign was made possible due to the cooperation with our partners:

IAPC - התאגדות מועדוני העיתונאים הבין לאומית- 

International Association of Press Clubs >> pressclubs.org

EFPC - הפדרציה האירופאית של מועדני העיתונאים - European Federation of Press Clubs >> pressclubs.org 

The Israeli Cartoon Museum - our partners from day one

המוזיאון הישראלי לקריקטורה וקומיקס, השותף המרכזי שלנו מיומה הראשון של התחרות >> cartoon.org.il

Arta Art Graphic &  Office Suuplies - רשת חנויות "ארטא" ציוד לאומנות, גרפיקה ומשרד >> arta-israel.co.il

Comics and Vegetables stores - חנויות הקומיקס "קומיקס וירקות" >> cnv.co.il

ZotZot (bags and coasters print and design) a social enterprise designed to employ and empower women, ex-prisoners - סטודיו zotzot (הדפסה על תיקים ותחתיות לכוסות) - עסק חברתי להדפסה על מוצרים, מקום עבודה מכבד ואיכותי שמעסיק נשים, אסירות לשעבר ומאפשר להן להרגיש בטחון, לרכוש כלים ומיומנויות עבודה ולקחת חלק בתהליך היצירה >> zotzot.co.il 

Touro Restaurant - Mediterranean chef restaurant in Jerusalem - מסעדת טורו - מסעדת שף ים-תיכונית בירושלים >> touro.co.il

Maayan Leshem - One of Jerusalem's best story tellers - מעיין לשם - מורה דרך ואחד ממספרי הסיפורים הטובים ביותר בירושלים >> tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g293983-d7262267-Reviews-Maayan_Leshem_Tour_Guide_Jerusalem_Old_City_Highlights-Jerusalem_Jerusalem_Distri.html

 

 

 

Breakdown of how funds will be used

כיצד נשתמש בתמיכה שלכם:

15,000 $ - Perks for Crowd Funding supporters

8,000 $ - Global marketing strategy, online media and website 

10,000 $ - Global competition: Workshops, jury, prizes for winners including their visit to a global exhibition

7,000 $ - Production of at least 5 international exhibitions

 

15,000$ - תשורות לתומכים בקמפיין מימון המונים

8,000$ - אסטרטגיית שיווק בין לאומי, פרסום ברשתות חברתיות ותחזוק אתר

10,000$ - תחרות בין לאומית: סדנאות, חבר שופטים, פרסים לזוכים, כולל ביקור בתערוכה בין לאומית

7,000$ - הפקה של לפחות 5 תערוכות בין לאומיות

 

 

 

 

 Additional information

Set of 9 cards (13X18) will include the following caricatures:

סט של 9 גלויות בגודל 18*13 יכלול את הקריקטורות הבאות:

 

The BAG!

Choose your favorite cartoon our of three options:

בחרו את הקריקטורה המועדפת עליכם מבין שלוש האפשרויות:

 

Click here to read the explanation about each cartoon!

לחצו כאן כדי לקרוא את ההסברים על כל הקריקטורות!

 

Choose a beautiful Museum Catalog

בחרו קטלוג ממוזיאון הקומיקס

 

Signed caricature by Michel Kichka!

קריקטורה חתומה על ידי מישל קישקה! 

 

Choose an original framed caricature

בחרו קריקטורה מקורית וממוסגרת הישר מקיר התערוכה!

In order to choose a framed caricature, click here and choose your preferred cartoon from the past three competitions. Please contact us to let us know which cartoon you chose. Remember that the framed caricatures are provided in Israel only and are to be picked up from Jerusalem or from the area of the center of the country.

על מנת לבחור תמונה ממוסגרת לחצו כאן ובחרו את הקריקטורה המועדפת עליכם משלוש התחרויות האחרונות. אנא צרו עמנו קשר באמצעות עמוד זה או באמצעות הפייסבוק וידעו אותנו באיזו קריקטורה בחרתם. זכרו שניתן לקבל את התמונות הממוסגרות בישראל בלבד ובאיסוף עצמי מירושלים או מאזור המרכז. 

 

תודה על תמיכתכם!

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Summary

* Some of the earliest comics I remember are the stack of DELL comics my maternal grandmother and great-grandmother had kept. (Mom's super-hero and horror comics apparently sold fast at a rummage sale.) Those scattered issues of Four Color really helped build up the love of comics I have to this day and the inspiration for me to enter the industry, focusing on genres beyond capes and tights.  As I got older, I learned more of the industry's history and what became of DELL after they parted ways with Western Publishing. It was there I learned about the crew that would become SECTION: M. 
    DELL still chugged along doing TV and movie tie-ins, but when Batman became the surprise hit of 1966, their lack of super-heroes became a liability at the newsstand. Having produced one-shots of Frankenstein and Dracula, loosely based on the Universal films, the editors reasoned that if kids liked monsters and they liked super-heroes, why not combine the two? The results were... interesting. But they also had a certain charm.  

  FRANKENSTEIN, DRACULA, WEREWOLF... Plus more traditional hero types like NUKLA and the FAB 4 may not have been as slick as DC, as "in your face" as Marvel or have the mix of nostalgia and camp the Archie hero revival had, but they had something. These characters had POTENTIAL. They stayed with you and you would think, "Maybe if they had..." But as time went on and DELL was broken up and sold off, the characters were abandoned. 

SECTION: M  is the result of my adopting these orphaned characters and trying to help them reach that potential. Picking them up as if their books had made it beyond the 4-6 issue runs in the mid-60s and bringing them into the 21st Century. With art by the team of Federico Zumel and Stuart Berryhill and a standard cover by Ron Joseph (GI Joe and ROM from IDW), we hope to bring you a mix of old school storytelling with a modern flair with some of the WILDEST characters to ever grace the pages. 

As for why Indiegogo after two successful Kickstarters? Kickstarter is great, but as I looked at recent trends, it seems the super hero-style projects have struggled there of late. We're on a mission to make this book happen and feel IndieGoGo is the best place to do it. 

Who's Involved?

Sean Dulaney is the writer and instigator of the project. Breaking in as an artist in Mike Hoffman's TIGRESS TALES PIN-UP BOOK, he transitioned to writing, launching Dreah, Queen of Thieves, F. Stein: Consulting Detective and Kendar the Jungle Lord in DIGITAL WEBBING PRESENTS. His involvement in Platinum Studios' "Comic Book Challenge" led to creation of the 51 DELTA graphic novel for Arcana. Recent projects include SUPERSONIC for Arcana, MISS VICKY and her CUTIE COMMANDOS with his Bimor Comics imprint and THE "IT" GIRL MURDERS coming in 2019 from Markosia.    

Penciler Federico Zumel is an Argentinean comic book artist who has been working for the US market for 17 years, working for companies like Penny Farthing Press, Approbation Comics, Forcewerks,PicklePress, Bughouse Comics, Advent Comics and Big City Comics; as well for many independent writers and creators. His influences go from Marc Silvestri, Greg Capullo and Claudio Castelllini to Milton Caniff, Alex Raymond and Stan Drake.

Stuart Berryhill is inking a second project with Sean, having worked on THE "IT" GIRL MURDERS over pencils by Kurt Belcher. He's no stranger to the Monster Heroes, having penciled and inked the first meeting of Frankenstein and Dracula in CELEBRATION COMICS #2

What We Need & What You Get

Plain and simple, our initial goal covers the cost of production. That's the pencils, inks, letters and colors. The printing cost will be dictated by the final number of physical copies needed and a portion of an initial print run has been built in to our starting goal as well. Rather than overload you with variants, we're starting with one by Ryan Sergeant (Dreah, 51 DELTA) and a blank cover for sketches. We also are breaking into the vault for some of the early appearances we've done with the characters

"But what if you get the goal early on?"   

We have a few stretch goals planned. The initial stretch goal will be at $3500, where we will add a back-up story featuring the first meeting of Dracula '66 and Frankenstein (originally presented in CELEBRATION COMICS #2) presented in color for the first time. 

  • At $4000, we will unlock a second series of action stickers of the characters.
  • At $4500, the DRACULA '66 collector pin is unlocked. 
  • Beyond that... Well, we've got to have a few surprises.  

You May Be Asking...

"Why should I back SECTION: M? Aren't there enough super-hero books out there? What makes this project different?"

​If you're predisposed to not like capes and tights, SECTION: M isn't going to change your mind. If anything, it's even more of a throwback than a lot of the 90s-style super-hero projects that have been promoted of late. This isn't kitschy 1960s heroes viewed through a post-Watchmen/Dark Knight filter. It's more akin to the 60s and 70s revivals of Golden Age characters. Think Roy Thomas' AVENGERS and INVADERS. Len Wein on JLA. The first couple of years of the Wolfman/Perez  TITANS run. Action and character development that you could enjoy as a grown-up fan and hand it off to a kid without worrying about "adult" content. In other words, "All Ages" without being so "Kiddie" that it makes Casper read like Alan Moore. It's late-Silver Age characters facing the Digital Age with a Bronze Age attitude.

Risks & Challenges

Indiegogo is new to me, but I have overseen two successful Kickstarter campaigns and have overcome a lot of the hurdles that can pop up in crowdfunded comics. While the book is not yet complete, the team is in place and committed to producing the book and having it ready by the time the con season begins in earnest around Feb/March. Our printer is US based, so shipping delays due to literal "slow boats from China" are not a concern. And all evidence found in our thorough research show the characters to be orphaned with no claimant to their rights.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that with this time of year being the ramp-up to the holiday season, some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

If you can't help but are into the characters, help us get the word out about the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools to post the link on your social media, or giving the link directly to someone you think would enjoy the book.
story_txt:
Summary
* Some of the earliest comics I remember are the stack of DELL comics my maternal grandmother and great-grandmother had kept. (Mom's super-hero and horror comics apparently sold fast at a rummage sale.) Those scattered issues of Four Color really helped build up the love of comics I have to this day and the inspiration for me to enter the industry, focusing on genres beyond capes and tights.  As I got older, I learned more of the industry's history and what became of DELL after they parted ways with Western Publishing. It was there I learned about the crew that would become SECTION: M.     DELL still chugged along doing TV and movie tie-ins, but when Batman became the surprise hit of 1966, their lack of super-heroes became a liability at the newsstand. Having produced one-shots of Frankenstein and Dracula, loosely based on the Universal films, the editors reasoned that if kids liked monsters and they liked super-heroes, why not combine the two? The results were... interesting. But they also had a certain charm.  

  FRANKENSTEIN, DRACULA, WEREWOLF... Plus more traditional hero types like NUKLA and the FAB 4 may not have been as slick as DC, as "in your face" as Marvel or have the mix of nostalgia and camp the Archie hero revival had, but they had something. These characters had POTENTIAL. They stayed with you and you would think, "Maybe if they had..." But as time went on and DELL was broken up and sold off, the characters were abandoned. 
SECTION: M  is the result of my adopting these orphaned characters and trying to help them reach that potential. Picking them up as if their books had made it beyond the 4-6 issue runs in the mid-60s and bringing them into the 21st Century. With art by the team of Federico Zumel and Stuart Berryhill and a standard cover by Ron Joseph (GI Joe and ROM from IDW), we hope to bring you a mix of old school storytelling with a modern flair with some of the WILDEST characters to ever grace the pages. 

As for why Indiegogo after two successful Kickstarters? Kickstarter is great, but as I looked at recent trends, it seems the super hero-style projects have struggled there of late. We're on a mission to make this book happen and feel IndieGoGo is the best place to do it. 
Who's Involved?
Sean Dulaney is the writer and instigator of the project. Breaking in as an artist in Mike Hoffman's TIGRESS TALES PIN-UP BOOK, he transitioned to writing, launching Dreah, Queen of Thieves, F. Stein: Consulting Detective and Kendar the Jungle Lord in DIGITAL WEBBING PRESENTS. His involvement in Platinum Studios' "Comic Book Challenge" led to creation of the 51 DELTA graphic novel for Arcana. Recent projects include SUPERSONIC for Arcana, MISS VICKY and her CUTIE COMMANDOS with his Bimor Comics imprint and THE "IT" GIRL MURDERS coming in 2019 from Markosia.    

Penciler Federico Zumel is an Argentinean comic book artist who has been working for the US market for 17 years, working for companies like Penny Farthing Press, Approbation Comics, Forcewerks,PicklePress, Bughouse Comics, Advent Comics and Big City Comics; as well for many independent writers and creators. His influences go from Marc Silvestri, Greg Capullo and Claudio Castelllini to Milton Caniff, Alex Raymond and Stan Drake.

Stuart Berryhill is inking a second project with Sean, having worked on THE "IT" GIRL MURDERS over pencils by Kurt Belcher. He's no stranger to the Monster Heroes, having penciled and inked the first meeting of Frankenstein and Dracula in CELEBRATION COMICS #2

What We Need & What You Get
Plain and simple, our initial goal covers the cost of production. That's the pencils, inks, letters and colors. The printing cost will be dictated by the final number of physical copies needed and a portion of an initial print run has been built in to our starting goal as well. Rather than overload you with variants, we're starting with one by Ryan Sergeant (Dreah, 51 DELTA) and a blank cover for sketches. We also are breaking into the vault for some of the early appearances we've done with the characters
"But what if you get the goal early on?"   
We have a few stretch goals planned. The initial stretch goal will be at $3500, where we will add a back-up story featuring the first meeting of Dracula '66 and Frankenstein (originally presented in CELEBRATION COMICS #2) presented in color for the first time. 

At $4000, we will unlock a second series of action stickers of the characters.
At $4500, the DRACULA '66 collector pin is unlocked. 
Beyond that... Well, we've got to have a few surprises.  


You May Be Asking...
"Why should I back SECTION: M? Aren't there enough super-hero books out there? What makes this project different?"​If you're predisposed to not like capes and tights, SECTION: M isn't going to change your mind. If anything, it's even more of a throwback than a lot of the 90s-style super-hero projects that have been promoted of late. This isn't kitschy 1960s heroes viewed through a post-Watchmen/Dark Knight filter. It's more akin to the 60s and 70s revivals of Golden Age characters. Think Roy Thomas' AVENGERS and INVADERS. Len Wein on JLA. The first couple of years of the Wolfman/Perez  TITANS run. Action and character development that you could enjoy as a grown-up fan and hand it off to a kid without worrying about "adult" content. In other words, "All Ages" without being so "Kiddie" that it makes Casper read like Alan Moore. It's late-Silver Age characters facing the Digital Age with a Bronze Age attitude.

Risks & Challenges
Indiegogo is new to me, but I have overseen two successful Kickstarter campaigns and have overcome a lot of the hurdles that can pop up in crowdfunded comics. While the book is not yet complete, the team is in place and committed to producing the book and having it ready by the time the con season begins in earnest around Feb/March. Our printer is US based, so shipping delays due to literal "slow boats from China" are not a concern. And all evidence found in our thorough research show the characters to be orphaned with no claimant to their rights.  

Other Ways You Can Help
We realize that with this time of year being the ramp-up to the holiday season, some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
If you can't help but are into the characters, help us get the word out about the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools to post the link on your social media, or giving the link directly to someone you think would enjoy the book.

story:
LITTLE FUZZY will tug at your heart-strings.

The Fuzzies are cute and adorable. You will want to take them home.

That's the problem--they are already home. But can they keep their home?

H. BEAM PIPER’S LITTLE FUZZY THE GRAPHIC NOVEL is based on Mr. Piper’s cult classic 1962 novel, Little Fuzzy.

Charles Santino (story and script) is best known for his adaptations of Louis L’Amour, Edgar Rice Burroughs (for the web comic site), and his original Conan stories for Marvel. With Walter Brogan, he created Danny and Harry Private Detectives. He edited Olaf Stapledon's Nebula Maker/Four Encounters with a cover and illustrations by Jim Starlin.

Marco Perugini’s was creative director for online and offline projects for brands including: Nokia, D&G, IBM, RAI (Italian national channel), FOX. He's published three books for the magazine "Morgan Lost" for Sergio Bonelli Editore. Other credits include "Samuel Stern" for Bugs Comics a story in "Heavy Metal,"

LITTLE FUZZY THE GRAPHIC NOVEL will be published digitally under Santino’s MHE (Marshall Holt Entertainment) imprint.

Page count will be 80-100 pages.

$7.00 gets you the digital.

We expect to deliver early in 2021.

During the campaign, MHE will reach out to publishers to establish a print partnership, but this campaign is for digital only.

The story? If our kindhearted hero, Jack Holloway, can’t prove that the Fuzzies are intelligent, their entire species will be wiped off the face of their planet, Zarathustra--a planet owned by a mining company.

There’s already been some controversy surrounding this adaptation.

What’s the controversy about?

It’s about three major changes we’re making to the story, changes that have bothered some die-hard fans of the novel:

1) Jack Holloway, portrayed as a male in the novel, will be portrayed as a female in this adaptation. Why? Not for the reasons you might imagine.

2) The Fuzzies will have a lot more "screen time" in the graphic novel then they did in the book. Why? You want to see Fuzzies. We want to get them into as many panels as possible.

3). The Fuzzies will be depicted as sapient very early on in the story. Why? Because it’s obvious that they are. We feel that it’s more interesting to characterize those who oppose these lovable creatures as morally challenged, not stupid.

We hope that everyone—readers who are new to this story, and fans of the novel—will give this freewheeling, fun adaptation a chance.

Where can I see and read more about this project?

The free pdf that contains the cover, three finished pages, preliminary sketches, unused designs, script samples, and an introduction ("As Fuzzy As They Wanna Be") explaining how the graphic novel proposal was conceived. Go here for that:                               https://www.subscribepage.com/x2z3r9

story:
Star of Destiny is a serial fantasy/action comic about Star, a teenage sorceress-in-training from the tiny village of Taloz. Having grown up in a remote village, Star has seen her home as a cage. She dreams of seeing the outside world and has trained to be a sorceress for that day, even seeking out to become an apprentice to one of the greatest sorceress of the land. The day she turns of age, Star's hope becomes reality when she's invited to be tested for apprenticeship. However, everything goes wrong when the King of Narovia - a crazed man who brings destruction where he goes for seemingly no reason - decides to trap her within his plans and to target the home she left behind.

Done in a Japanese comic style, typically known as manga, Star of Destiny was the first story I ever created. It's changed a lot from my early days of story writing and has always remained my favourite story to write. This is actually a reboot for Star of Destiny as the first version made comic form was not the best. Now Star of Destiny is arguably one of my best stories, which is good since the story has so much meaning to me. Not only was it the first one I ever made, but a lot of its early development and ideas (many of which are still being used) came at a rather important period in my life. I wouldn't be on this course to be a writer if I didn't meet the people I did at that time, make the decisions I made and ultimately created this story.

If you want to see what it's all about, you can read the first chapter (aka the very thing we're printing here) for free on Tapastic:

https://tapastic.com/series/starofdestiny

If you're seeing this campaign when it's new, we'll be updating with a new episode consisting of 9 pages of the comic from now until when it's all posted, so just give it some time.


My name is Drew Byrne and I'm the writer of Star of Destiny. I've been writing since the early 2000s and producing comics since 2007. The first comic I ever produced was the first version of Star of Destiny, which this is completely erasing and rebooting. My first comic ever printed was Snowbound, which happened thanks to lots of people out there who believed in me and supported me to get that made.

My dream in life is to write stories for people, such as yourself, to read and enjoy and to build worlds that are full of life. I work in comics because it's a media that is easier to produce yet still allows readers to see the worlds I create for what they are. This marks an important point in that dream, given it will be my second book printed ever.

To make Star of Destiny, I've teamed up with Champo Studios, a comic group in Indonesia, and worked with Erwin Prasetya to produce the artwork. Erwin has been drawing (or at least posting artwork) since 2008. He's worked on several independent comics and in 2013 won an award with Silent Manga Audition, an open competition held by Coamix for Japanese style comics with no spoken dialogue. I also had my friend Christine Chong, otherwise known as Mayshing and the character artist for Snowbound from its second chapter and on, handle drafting of Star of Destiny. The resulting style is an odd mix of Erwin's and Christine's works. I'm also working with another friend and the creator of the webcomic Moonlight Apparition, Janaka Davis. Janaka is acting as editor for Star of Destiny and will also be making a couple of short comics that will be exclusive to backers of this campaign!


For this campaign, we're looking to raise $1200 USD. Here's where the money goes:

$630 (52.5%) goes to printing the first chapter/issue in book form and covering the extra comics being made by Janaka Davis.
$200 (16.7%) goes towards rewards fulfillment, getting any required art made and printing physical rewards (except the issue/book, which is covered above)
$120 (10%) goes to Indiegogo and Paypal for processing fees. Indiegogo takes 5% while Paypal takes 3-5% collectively, meaning it can be up to $120.
$250 (20.8%) goes to shipping for physical rewards. If we go over our goal, the amount used for shipping will go up to cover shipping more issues/books. If this amount seems high, that's because I live in Canada and Canada is ridiculous for shipping.

For perks, we have a variety of things we're offering to backers, with more to be added if we hit stretch goals! Here's a list of what you can currently get (more will be added if we hit stretch goals):

  • A high-quality digital wallpaper of Star of Skye at three difference sizes to fit the three most common resolution ratios - 4:3, 16:9 and 16:10
  • A pair of 1.25" buttons, featuring miniaturized-styled artwork of Star and Skye respectively.
  • An 11x17" poster print of Star and Skye!
  • A printed copy of the first chapter of Star of Destiny, complete with bonus comic strips written and drawn by Janaka Davis. Most of these strips will be exclusive to backers and not appear in other prints.
  • A cameo in our next chapter as a citizen of Star's village, Taloz!
So what are our tiers? Well, the tiers look something like this:
Rewards Guide:

Any bonuses we get thanks to stretch goals will be placed at a specific spot, but if you're going for a smaller goal and want a specific stretch goal bonus, you can donate a specific amount for it.


Campaigns like this often come with risks and challenges to them. After all, this is a fairly new comic that's running here. While this is the first print run for Star of Destiny, it's not my first produced comic nor my first print run. During a previous campaign for another story, I learned a great deal on producing and printing graphic novels. We had a few hiccups that delayed things during production and even a few in printing. However, the experience taught me how to work to keep production going and get printing done faster. While the chapter is done, the comic strips being done as a bonus are still to be made. As such, these lessons will play a big part in keeping things on track.
Beyond this, the biggest challenge comes not from the production of chapter/issue, posters and buttons, since our printers are, for the most part, ready to go. Our real challenge is if we can produce a story that you enjoy. This is our ultimate goal and is an ongoing challenge. However, this is something we can accomplish. Everyone involved in Star of Destiny's comic has experience writing, making comics or both, giving us a lot of feedback on what does and doesn't work. We're going to be constantly looking at what makes things interesting and entertaining to readers, while also ensuring the story being told is one we like. As for you, you can find out right now if you're interested by reading what we've released of the first chapter over on Tapastic!
https://tapastic.com/series/starofdestiny

So let's say you like what you see so far. You might be wondering what you can do to help and how much it can impact this project. Well for starters, you can back us here! Financial backing is the biggest and clearest sign that people are interested in Star of Destiny and want to see more. The more we raise, the more we can do. While our goal only gets us to print, going beyond it lets us continue to make more of Star of Destiny at a much faster rate than we'd otherwise be able to (we'll be listing what we need to produce and print each chapter up to the production of a full volume as stretch goals once we've worked out the numbers, so you can personally see how much we need to keep going).

If you're unable to contribute, what you can also do is spread the word: tell your friends and family about us, share our campaign online using the Indiegogo share tools, and overall help us get known. The more people who come through this campaign while it's active, the more likely we are to find new readers. New readers also means we're more likely to hit our goal and beyond. In short, most of the power  of this campaign resides with you!

So if you want to see Star of Destiny be a thing, back our campaign, share us with everyone you know and let your voices be heard!

story:
Summary

Welcome to the Caspian Porter Ultimate Edition campaign! Caspian Porter is a new SCI-FI series based on a space delivery man, his robot, and the wild things that continually happen to them.  If you like classic sci-fi, space, time travel, dinosoars, then this is for YOU!

Caspian Porter issues #0 & 1 were recently funded on Kickstarter as separate issues. But NOW comes the ULTIMATE EDITION! Both issues are being  combined into ONE book.  Thats right, the original 2 issues, plus the variant covers inside.  This book is 44 pages with a card stock cover! Only available on Indiegogo!

 

 

 

 

 

 

Story

Prelude:  My Ray Gun is My Jetpack 

This special prelude issue tells the events leading up to part one.  Caspian awakes in the bed of an unknown woman and recalls the night before where he drunkenly gambled away something he doesn't own. Low-behold, this unknown woman is the wife of the CEO, the CEO of the company Caspian works for!

 

Part 1: A Gazillion Years From Home

Caspian Porter is on the run! Hot on his tail are the SMCI Corporation's corporate cronies, ready to commandeer the ship, Assurance, a vessel that Caspian was given to perform an important task; shipping much needed supplies to the outer colonies. He failed, and now it's time to pay back the corporation with his life!

Follow Caspian, along with his Service Robot named, C.R.B. (Curbie), on this wild new adventure as he finds himself in heaps and bounds more trouble along the way. Caspian will face death, time, and prehistoric dinosaurs in this first issue of an ongoing series!

 

Preview

Rewards

 

 

 

 

Reviews

Caspian Porter has been reviewed by a number of websites.  Check it out!

 

"It should be said from the outset that I’m a big fan of sci-fi. My personal journey to nerdom started with comics, Star Trek, and Mystery Science Theater 3000 (with an early foundation of The Empire Strikes Back). With that mix of dorkery, Caspian Porter hit just about every note of my personal geek-song." 

Brett Hillesheim - Indie Comix Dispatch

 

"Exciting, engaging and just plain fun; Caspian Porter is a rip-roaring space caper in the style of a classic sci-fi adventure!"

Morgan Quaid - Super Serious Comics

 

"The reader will surely empathize with this example of a regular guy who falls far short of perfection, despite his unflinching confidence in his own abilities..."

Zak Webber - Sci-Fi Comic Nexus

 

Creators

Drew D. Lenhart - Writer - Letterer - Creator  

Drew has been writing, creating, and publishing since 2017 first starting with Future Sci-Fi Tales, which consisted of his own set of anthology stories.  Since then he's released a number of anthology issues ( science fiction and horror), as well as a number of one-shot books. He currently lives in Indiana with his wife and daughters.

Instagram:  https://instagram.com/snowyworks

 

Juan Fleites - Line Art

Juan has been a comic artist since 2000, starting in erotic comics and eventually working on sci-fi, horror, fantasy, and slice of life. He likes grind house and retro movies, Iron Maiden, and is a big fan of silent actress Louise Brooks. He lives in Yucatán with his wife and sons.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/juan_fleites/

 

Jonathan Wetmore - Colorist

Jonathan is a comic colorist and game designer.  By day he is a mild-mannered architect. He currently lives in San Diego with his wife and daughter.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jw_creative_works/

 

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges of this campaign are relatively low. This book is 100% complete and ready to print. The campaign is just for the printing funds. As soon as the funds are received, the books will be ordered and shipped out as soon as I receive them!

I've also had a previous successful campaigns, so I know what it takes to communicate and get rewards out to all backers as promised. I've also been working on indy comics for the last 4 years, with experience producing and preparing comics, as well as working directly with printing companies.

There could be unforeseen issues with the printer, late delivery due to COVID, or damages. I'll do my best to mitigate any problems and keep everyone updated on potential delays.

 

 

THANK YOU!!

Your backing gets this new awesome edition printed, as well as it helps support our work on Caspian Porter #2!!
story_txt:
Summary
Welcome to the Caspian Porter Ultimate Edition campaign! Caspian Porter is a new SCI-FI series based on a space delivery man, his robot, and the wild things that continually happen to them.  If you like classic sci-fi, space, time travel, dinosoars, then this is for YOU!
Caspian Porter issues #0 & 1 were recently funded on Kickstarter as separate issues. But NOW comes the ULTIMATE EDITION! Both issues are being  combined into ONE book.  Thats right, the original 2 issues, plus the variant covers inside.  This book is 44 pages with a card stock cover! Only available on Indiegogo!
 

 
 
 
 
 
Story
Prelude:  My Ray Gun is My Jetpack 
This special prelude issue tells the events leading up to part one.  Caspian awakes in the bed of an unknown woman and recalls the night before where he drunkenly gambled away something he doesn't own. Low-behold, this unknown woman is the wife of the CEO, the CEO of the company Caspian works for!
 
Part 1: A Gazillion Years From Home
Caspian Porter is on the run! Hot on his tail are the SMCI Corporation's corporate cronies, ready to commandeer the ship, Assurance, a vessel that Caspian was given to perform an important task; shipping much needed supplies to the outer colonies. He failed, and now it's time to pay back the corporation with his life!
Follow Caspian, along with his Service Robot named, C.R.B. (Curbie), on this wild new adventure as he finds himself in heaps and bounds more trouble along the way. Caspian will face death, time, and prehistoric dinosaurs in this first issue of an ongoing series!
 
Preview







Rewards
 

 

 

 
Reviews
Caspian Porter has been reviewed by a number of websites.  Check it out!
 
"It should be said from the outset that I’m a big fan of sci-fi. My personal journey to nerdom started with comics, Star Trek, and Mystery Science Theater 3000 (with an early foundation of The Empire Strikes Back). With that mix of dorkery, Caspian Porter hit just about every note of my personal geek-song." 
Brett Hillesheim - Indie Comix Dispatch "Exciting, engaging and just plain fun; Caspian Porter is a rip-roaring space caper in the style of a classic sci-fi adventure!"
Morgan Quaid - Super Serious Comics "The reader will surely empathize with this example of a regular guy who falls far short of perfection, despite his unflinching confidence in his own abilities..."
Zak Webber - Sci-Fi Comic Nexus
 
Creators
Drew D. Lenhart - Writer - Letterer - Creator  
Drew has been writing, creating, and publishing since 2017 first starting with Future Sci-Fi Tales, which consisted of his own set of anthology stories.  Since then he's released a number of anthology issues ( science fiction and horror), as well as a number of one-shot books. He currently lives in Indiana with his wife and daughters.
Instagram:  https://instagram.com/snowyworks Juan Fleites - Line Art
Juan has been a comic artist since 2000, starting in erotic comics and eventually working on sci-fi, horror, fantasy, and slice of life. He likes grind house and retro movies, Iron Maiden, and is a big fan of silent actress Louise Brooks. He lives in Yucatán with his wife and sons.
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/juan_fleites/ Jonathan Wetmore - Colorist
Jonathan is a comic colorist and game designer.  By day he is a mild-mannered architect. He currently lives in San Diego with his wife and daughter.
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jw_creative_works/
 
Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges of this campaign are relatively low. This book is 100% complete and ready to print. The campaign is just for the printing funds. As soon as the funds are received, the books will be ordered and shipped out as soon as I receive them!
I've also had a previous successful campaigns, so I know what it takes to communicate and get rewards out to all backers as promised. I've also been working on indy comics for the last 4 years, with experience producing and preparing comics, as well as working directly with printing companies.
There could be unforeseen issues with the printer, late delivery due to COVID, or damages. I'll do my best to mitigate any problems and keep everyone updated on potential delays.

Your backing gets this new awesome edition printed, as well as it helps support our work on Caspian Porter #2!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi,

My name is Brad Barber, and I'm a creative story writer. Since the age of eight, I've always thought of creating or producing a comic book/manga, but I soon realized that I was better at writing creative stories than creating art so I put more time into reading literature and books instead of watching the old shows like Avatar the last air bender, and DRAGON BALL Z. I soon learned that I could not put the story I had in my mind into someone else's without the visual part of the story, so I've come up with a plan:

What We Need & What You Get

I'm hiring full-time artists and illustrators to start drawing for me, and I need to pay them what they deserve. 

I've got a whole marketing plan for when the first volume is finished, but I need the funding to be able to accomplish this.

You will get a story-rich, professionally-written book with beautiful drawings.  

The Story Summary

An other-worldly prince has a lifelong rivalry with a rich human as they clash for the spot for King of Earth.

The prince at 16 soon realizes that he as no relation with anyone else because he was raised with a perfect life, so he fakes his death to go and live a simple life and learn from a wise martial artist. The rich human sees through the faked death and proceeds to get stronger than the prince. 

The book begins as the rivals return to take the throne.

story:
we are Manga Impact a small indie company that wants to bring you stories you will never forget! We produce "Monkie" a Shonen manga with the 7th chapter currently in production. The goal for this campaign is to promote Manga Impact and have funds to produce manga volumes more quickly! We want to get many stories out into the world and only will live so long to do so. If this is successful we will be able to release chapter 7 by December, as well as be able to release multiple chapters a year moving forward! Any one who loves manga or is interested in Manga Impacts work please help by funding this campaign and allowing us to take this small manga company to the next level.

  • Manga impact is a small American manga company.
  • Funding will allow us to start collecting more artists to do more work.
  • This would allow us to release manga on a set schedule starting with chapter 7 this December.
  • We would begin announcing books regularly for release, each containing stories you will never forget!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Currently only Christian Michaelis produces all aspects of the Manga released by Manga impact. The art, story, covers, and publishing. Your funding will provide us with the ability to dedicate more time and hire artists to release Manga on a regular basis with a set schedule. We want to get more manga out more quickly! With six previously released chapters before starting this campaign we have examples of the quality of work you will receive from Manga Impact.  We want to grow and create more stories, more importantly ensure the completion of Monkie!

  • The goal is 50,000. This will allow us to completely focus on manga exclusively. If reached we will send all backers of perk 1 (6 chapters) the chapter 7 release in December.

If you are a backer interested in our perks!

  • Perk 1: receive all 6 previously released chapters!
  • Perk 2: own a T-shirt with original art of Monkie created for this campaign!

details:

  • The first issue and chapters 5 + 6 are a combined 146 pages of panels conveying a story, with some extra content included as well.
  • All extra funds will go to future manga projects, this is a new manga company after all with many more stories to tell.

 

Your Impact on Manga Impact!

we want to start producing Manga chapters full time!

  • we want to make real stories that mean something to people with characters that grow, adventures that inspire, and entertainment that entertains! At Manga Impact we feel that American entertainment has largely failed in this regard. Of course stories should be meaningful however remain in the realm of fun entertainment. Not propaganda, nor dogma that forces consumers to accept bad elements mixed in with some good. The end goal of any product of Manga Impact is to serve as entertainment through good story telling, and nothing more.
  • If you like our previous work we will continue to do our best to impress. We love creating manga as much as you love reading it! If you are new here we hope you like what you see. Please read the excerpt below! check to find if you're interested.

Story synopsis:

MONKIE "a name given to her when she was kidnapped as a child" is the 
irreplaceable member of a notorious bandit group, gifted/cursed with 
extraordinary strength after eating the forbidden fruit. Which grants great 
powers to those that feast upon it. One day Monkie is lead to use her 
abilities to turn herself and fellow bandits from thieves into conquerors. 
With only memory of her life as a bandit and little understanding of the 
world beyond it, Monkie must come to terms with the result of her 
sometimes villainous actions...

 

  • We want to show the world our stories and art, and your support is highly appreciated!

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Even without the full minimum amount we will provide backers with all perks ordered. Chapter 7 will not be provided in this campaign unless the full minimum amount is reached. We will still strive to complete future chapters as quickly as possible but can't guarantee any specific release date. Monkie will also remain the only manga on the Manga impact's line up until further notice.
  • The next chapter will be produced regardless of the result of this campaign but it will take more time. The goal is to create as many stories as possible. if we can not reach the goals of this campaign it will take much longer, but we will do all that we can.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word and telling people about Manga Impact!

  • if you know someone who likes manga see if they are interested.
  • share, and follow Manga Impact on social media, a little goes a long way!

 

thank you,

We will keep fighting to bring you stories you will never forget!

website: http://mangaimpact.co

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone, we are Pioneer star comics. We are a comic startup in West Africa, Nigeria to be precise. Founded by two teenager boys who have a passion for comic books,graphic novels and telling stories through our art. We intend to create a platform through our comic book startup to tell inspiring African stories of various genres with our graphic novels. We are proud of our heritage as Africans. The funds we seek would go a long way in kicking off and actualizing this dream, by helping in the production and publication of our first graphic novel titled Slain. As we are financially incapable of realizing this dear dream of ours, your swift response would be encouraging and serve as a morale booster to us. Your support would be really appreciated no matter how little you may think it is. We look forward to your immense help. Thank you. 

What We Need & What You Get

For the goal to be achieved we would need these funds to get

A drawing pad such as an electronic tab

Various inks and pen

sketch pads

A4 

Also the funds would go into

Printing and Publication of the comic books

 

Challenges

The challenges we are facing are mainly in the aspect of financial capability

as we are just teenage boys we do not have enough funds to kick off this dear dream of ours 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please spread the word about this dear campaign
  • Please Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
STORY

Kayn and the extraterrestrial force Kourageous, discuss life in a city full of superpowered beings and the monotony of having the abilities without a purpose. And While Kayn tries to determine his powers and there purpose Kourageous opens Kayn's eyes to the true horrors of the city, deepening Kayn's fears and weakening his resolve.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Who am I?

Hello everyone! My name is DS Williams I am the creator of Kayn Kourageous. I was an art teacher and I currently have a YouTube channel that was used to help motivate my students. And although it was sometimes a fulfilling experience, being an art teacher was never my calling or goal. My goal has always been to become an Illustrator and create a graphic novel.

I hope to get help with the completion of a story I have been working on for many years, and with your assistance, I can finish the remaining half of the story arc.

Kayn Kourageous is more than just a story to me it’s my life just twisted into sci-fi fantasy. It’s a story I think for anyone who likes adventure and new experiences may enjoy and with your help, I will finally get the story off the ground because there is more to come.

they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise 75000 for this project. I produce art at a large scale with a lot of detail so it takes a long time to produce panels and I have over a hundred pages to produce to finish the book. So I figured that it would take over a year to finish the book. 75000 would take care of all my essential needs expenses and materials for a year along with printing costs once everything is completed. With that amount for the project, I can work nonstop and have this book done by 2021 and release a complete volume one of Kayn Kourageous finishing the story arc.

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Of course, if you can’t contribute please feel free to share my campaign with others who might be. Every bit of support helps and thank you.

story:
EVERMATTER: CONSCRIPT

Is a space fantasy adventure comic.

When unresolved mistakes of the past allow an ancient enemy once defeated and long since forgotten to make a sudden return the Tuath Dé Danann are forced to act. 

Corum a mage searching for redemption, Kira a warrior who has lost everything, and Gary a quick-witted alien must travel to earth in order to recruit a new conscript who proves to be much more than they could have imagined.

THE WHITE COVER

The white cover is EXCLUSIVELY available to the backers of this campaign.

There will only be enough of these covers printed to fulfill the requirements of this campaign and possibly a short in demand period. Once they're gone, they're gone, and will never be printed again. 

 

 

 

 

The Creative Team

Writer: Jerry Brown 

Artist: Carlos Trigo

Letterer: Eric Weathers 

Risks & Challenges

Crowdfunding campaigns inherently come with some risk but I have taken steps to minimize those risks by personally funding the majority of this comic. EverMatter is 90% completed.  The cover is completed. All of the page art is completed and Eric Weathers is currently working on the lettering. 

What's Left? Once the lettering is done there will be a round of editing, pre-press, more editing, a proof copy will be ordered from the printer. and another round of editing. Once all of the editings is done your books will be printed and shipped.

I have minimized the risk to you the backer by making sure the comic is mostly finished. 

Money earned by this campaign will go toward printing and shipping. Extra money earned will go toward a second comic.

 I need your support to make a high-quality comic. Please consider backing and help make EVERMATTER a reality! 

Thank you for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help EverMatter

Excited about the comic and want to HELP!

This amazing comic cannot fund without exposure. Word of mouth is the best marketing tool in the world. Help EverMatter get that exposure by sharing on ALL SOCIAL PLATFORMS!

Thank You!

story:
My name is Ben Fuselier. I am an aspiring writer from New Orleans, Louisiana. The movement of independent comics and the passion therein has inspired me to join their ranks. The new age is bringing in more power for the up and coming artist. Outlaw Nights is a story 10 years in the making; and one I hope to bring to you in a 6 issue miniseries. My dream is to keep the story going beyond this, continually cranking out issues, but that all depends on you!


 

THE STORY: In the distant future, humanity has begun colonization of other planets, stretching far beyond the Milky Way. The governments of Earth (the Inland), however, do not have a tight grip on their "New World" settlements, giving rise to a new age of revolution and piracy. In the midst of this tumultuous time, Cyrus Lawson seeks to carve out his own quiet life, away from the chaos, on a small, out of the way settlement known as Terez. His plans are short lived, as he is caught up in the machinations of the crew of Hazard, notorious pirates in pursuit of an ultimate prize! This prize has the potential to shake the foundations of the future. Will Cyrus survive this rat race? Will he be able to win the peace he so desires?

....there's one factor missing.....YOU!

 

Modern mainstream comics are suffering from a distinct lack of action and excitement; coming layered with heavy doses of on-the-nose propaganda. Outlaw Nights is the inverse. A future based on the past, with a new landscape of threats; blended together to spark your imagination. You don't want to miss this! (Note: mature themes; not recommended for children).

 

We are going to need to raise 10000 dollars to complete the book. It is an uphill battle, but this story is well worth it. Rest assured, if this campaign does not meet goal, all proceeds will be invested into more artwork and promotion for relaunch. This book WILL come out, one way or another!

To reserve a copy, click on one of the perks and fill out your information. If you do not wish to read, but like the idea, feel free to contribute! If you like the project, but cannot afford to support, please share and spread the word to friends and family! 

 

 

The design and gorgeous line work you have been witnessing is courtesy of the great Render Contender! Render is an up and coming independent artist who has been receiving a steady, and well deserved, stream of work: including Jon Malin's Graveyard Shift Volume 2! Check out samples of this master https://twitter.com/RenderContender.

Our colorist is the incredibly talented Press Colors, also known as Pressy Patanik. Pressy has worked on several independent books: bringing a HUUUGE amount of depth and dynamism!! Check out more of his work on https://alwayspressy.artstation.com.

 

Our goal is to reach $7,000, but we would like to reach $10,000 in order to ensure the highest quality and standards. Our only stretch goal will be for the 10,000 mark. If we can get there, we will be able to produce ORIGINAL TRADING CARDS AND POSTERS!!!! Be sure to back Outlaw Nights today! You will be funding an incredible story showcasing two titans of Comic Art!! This book will be your best purchase this year. Help us reach our goal to give you an original, genre blended thrill ride!
story_txt: My name is Ben Fuselier. I am an aspiring writer from New Orleans, Louisiana. The movement of independent comics and the passion therein has inspired me to join their ranks. The new age is bringing in more power for the up and coming artist. Outlaw Nights is a story 10 years in the making; and one I hope to bring to you in a 6 issue miniseries. My dream is to keep the story going beyond this, continually cranking out issues, but that all depends on you! THE STORY: In the distant future, humanity has begun colonization of other planets, stretching far beyond the Milky Way. The governments of Earth (the Inland), however, do not have a tight grip on their "New World" settlements, giving rise to a new age of revolution and piracy. In the midst of this tumultuous time, Cyrus Lawson seeks to carve out his own quiet life, away from the chaos, on a small, out of the way settlement known as Terez. His plans are short lived, as he is caught up in the machinations of the crew of Hazard, notorious pirates in pursuit of an ultimate prize! This prize has the potential to shake the foundations of the future. Will Cyrus survive this rat race? Will he be able to win the peace he so desires?....there's one factor missing.....YOU! Modern mainstream comics are suffering from a distinct lack of action and excitement; coming layered with heavy doses of on-the-nose propaganda. Outlaw Nights is the inverse. A future based on the past, with a new landscape of threats; blended together to spark your imagination. You don't want to miss this! (Note: mature themes; not recommended for children). We are going to need to raise 10000 dollars to complete the book. It is an uphill battle, but this story is well worth it. Rest assured, if this campaign does not meet goal, all proceeds will be invested into more artwork and promotion for relaunch. This book WILL come out, one way or another!To reserve a copy, click on one of the perks and fill out your information. If you do not wish to read, but like the idea, feel free to contribute! If you like the project, but cannot afford to support, please share and spread the word to friends and family!   The design and gorgeous line work you have been witnessing is courtesy of the great Render Contender! Render is an up and coming independent artist who has been receiving a steady, and well deserved, stream of work: including Jon Malin's Graveyard Shift Volume 2! Check out samples of this master https://twitter.com/RenderContender.Our colorist is the incredibly talented Press Colors, also known as Pressy Patanik. Pressy has worked on several independent books: bringing a HUUUGE amount of depth and dynamism!! Check out more of his work on https://alwayspressy.artstation.com. Our goal is to reach $7,000, but we would like to reach $10,000 in order to ensure the highest quality and standards. Our only stretch goal will be for the 10,000 mark. If we can get there, we will be able to produce ORIGINAL TRADING CARDS AND POSTERS!!!! Be sure to back Outlaw Nights today! You will be funding an incredible story showcasing two titans of Comic Art!! This book will be your best purchase this year. Help us reach our goal to give you an original, genre blended thrill ride!

story:
If you're not familiar with us, my name is Joeming Dunn, and I run Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1984. I have personally collected comics of almost every type and genre since 1974, and I can say that during the past 30 years, we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics out there. Our publishing history includes titles like Gold Digger and Ninja High School, and naturally, T-shirts are among the merchandise we've produced for them. Over the past several years, we have also released a number of great parody shirts. You may have seen some of them at a comic book or sci-fi convention.

Our aim is to expand our line of shirts and create them on a more regular basis. To this end, we hope to use the Kickstarter funds to help us achieve that goal. The shirts themselves are 100% cotton ring weave and will be offered in sizes ranging from Small to XXX-Large.

Design 1: FOR FEW MANDOS MORE

Oh, baby, this IS the way...to get one of the best T-shirts you could wear!  No  need to hunt this bounty of style; we've got it for you right here.  People have heard the tales, so show 'em you're the man (or woman) da lore is all about.  And it's machine washable in case the little green monster you're babysitting decides to use the Force of strained peas all over you.

 

Design 2: X-RAY FIGHTER

Forget smuggling in blueprints via droid, we've got the plans for an awesome T-shirt!  Just look at the lines on this baby!  These X-Ray Fighter shirts themselves are 100% opaque, but you can see right through to how fashionable and affordable a deal they are.  Scoring one of these is as easy as bull's-eyeing womp rats in your T-16!

 

Design 3: MOVE ALONG

 

 

We don't need to see your identification, but this IS the shirt you're looking for.  Wear one of these and go about your business out on the moisture farm or in the hive of scum and villainy of your choice.  We're not playing mind tricks, 'cause we're sure we won't have to Force you to get a shirt like this.

 

HERE ARE THE REWARDS

Currently, we produce our shirts on a limited basis. We must estimate how much we might sell based on a variety of distribution lines, and we then produce that amount. Unfortunately, this can mean some of the most popular shirts sell out, and fast. And due to the nature of printing of the shirts through a third party, producing additional runs tends to incur extraordinary costs, making it not financially feasible. While we don't expect to be able to purchase a T-shirt printing facility, by holding these campaigns periodically, we hope to earn enough to allow us to do higher initial print runs, making it easier to get our shirts out to you. Eventually, we want have a process by which we can print our shirts at any time

 

Size Chart

 

 

Risks and challenges

There is always risk with any campaign, but over the past 5 years, we have produced a multitude of shirts without any problems. We have a variety of different shirt printers we have worked with over the years, and we choose the one we think will produce the most high quality shirt in the fastest amount of time. We have experience in producing, packaging and sending out product like this in our 30 years in business, so we do not anticipate any difficulty in fulfilling this campaign.

story:
There's three great covers to choose from!

Welcome everyone! I'm John Daniel Taylor IV and this is the Malone Gridlock #1 and TSP Sketchbook #1 Indiegogo! While not my first Indiegogo campaign, it is my first NEW full comic book project on this platform. I hope you guys can see to helping me fund this project. I've got 50-plus successful projects behind me, so my ability to deliver is not in question. I'm all about making comics and getting them to you.

I don't like to beat around the bush, so, let's get started!


Malone Gridlock concept sketches by Fabrizio Ugolini. Artwork is
available in The 2020 TSP Sketchbook (see below)

After Vietnam, Gridlock returned to Grand Metro City. But the city he grew up in, and learned to love, had become a different place. Super humans, as well as super villains had turned the town into a dangerous, violent city of crime. As a normal powered human, Gridlock felt helpless, but that was to change...

Not long after his return, Gridlock was accidently exposed to a dose of unknown dark-matter energy. This accident left him with strange powers. He is fast and almost invulnerable at times. While he is highly intelligent, he sometimes let's his emotions get the better of him. This, coupled with his invulnerable powers, gives him the habit of running into places without fear which from time to time leads to dire consequences.

His powers can be fickle, though. He has not mastered his strength. At times he has the ability to bench car weight; while other times he can barely rip off a door. 

Scarlet Death concept sketch by Fabrizio Ugolini. Artwork is
available in The 2020 TSP Sketchbook (see below)

It is the 1970's  ...several years after Gridlock acquired his powers. 

The age of costumed heroes and villains continues. One such villain, Scarlet Death, plans to destroy Grand Metro City! With the help of his Ravens, he has put together a hybrid Tesla machine that will cause (what he thinks) a massive explosion, and cripple Grand Metro City's electrical grid!

Enter Malone Gridlock! He has been tracking Scarlet Death after several technology heists by the masked villain. And not just any technology, but technology exotic for it's time. Now, the hunt has led him to the top of a warehouse in the Docks District; inside the building was his prey!

Gridlock, not always a man for plans, takes the direct route and ends up in the middle of Scarlet Death and his Ravens. His impetuous act lands him in hot water and he is soon captured.

The stage is set, and Gridlock finds himself tied to the machine, becoming a conduit for its power! But his powers reach into the dark matter of space, so, instead of being destroyed, he is transported into the future. Once there, he discovers a terrible secret. His enemy has taken over Grand Metro City!

Now, it's up to Gridlock stop his enemy once and for all; no matter the cost!


Raven concept sketch by Fabrizio Ugolini.









A little about the creative team...
These guys have all been (and are) a great team on this book. I think the pages you see so far are a testament to that. Each person brought their unique talent to the creation of the final product. I could sit here and write more praise, but I think you guys get the idea!



It's been a while since I made a Sketchbook. The last one was 2017.  I like doing these yearly annuals, but after a few years it became hard to fill 48 pages with original and new art.



Saying that, I feel like I have come to that bridge now, and I want to make the 2020 TSP Sketchbook! This book will feature 48 pages of current artists from Top Secret Press comics of the last two years. Inside will be filled with unreleased material that's never been seen before. Comics featured will include : Betty Wicked, The Seventh Sister, and Legend: Hell's Executioner to name a few. There will also be a special section dedicated to material from the Malone Gridlock comic by Artist Fabrizio Ugolini!



I made this 2020 Sketchbook Perk as an Add On (PDF as well as a Physical copy).  The only way to get it, is in conjunction with Malone Gridlock #1 Perk.  It's not available on its own.  This also includes Add On levels for the older TSP Sketchbooks of 2015 (3rd printing), 2016, 2017. The only Perk to include the sketchbooks is the 'ALL TSP COMICS PERKS' which include all 4 of the sketchbooks.



I've been fairly limited on the amount of sketchbook printings I make, so this printing will be no different. I will only make a small amount of extras for this Indiegogo.



One last thing...
We're all in this together! Making indie comics is a group effort and we can't do it without your full support!  We want everyone you to enjoy Top Secret Press comics and most of all we want you to join in! 

Thanks Faithful Ones! Pass on the word, and help us reach the Goal!
John Daniel Taylor IV
Top Secret Press

Here are the Add On's for the project.




 

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Want to check out Top Secret Press?

WEB SITE: www.topsecretpress.com 
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/topsecretpress 
TWITTER: https://twitter.com/TSPCMX 
INSTAGRAM: www.instagram.com/tspcmx 
ETSY: www.etsy.com/shop/TopSecretPress 

Thanks for reading through!
JDT, Top Secret Press

story:
¡Aquí tienes la versión en español del proyecto!)

Link: http://kck.st/1LyKyQc

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Forgotten Colors are wonderfully illustrated stories about freedom, imagination, empathy, creativity, courage, the small pleasures, love and many other things that take part in our day and shape our life. Do you like the attiude?

A project from the acclaimed Spanish illustrator David G. Forés, written by Silvia G. Guirado, and with the collaboration of different artists (check the credits of the project below).

Forgotten Colors is our way to look at the world: the fairest balance of humor and sense. Are you 15, 35 or 60? What difference does it make! We deal with home remedies about the human being, whoever you are, wherever you come from.

Inspired by the all-time greats such as ‘The wonderful wizard of Oz’ and ‘The never-ending story’; books like ‘Fahrenheit 451’ and ‘The little prince’; films such as ‘Back to the future’, ‘Dead Poets Society’ and ‘Blade Runner’ and cultural models such as B.B.King and Tim Burton.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Why do we use IndieGogo?

1. We’d like to distribute Forgotten Colors world widely
The book Forgotten Colors and other illustrated stories has already been published in several countries such as Spain, Brazil and Korea, where already many people have been immersed in our attitude. It is already printed, so we just need your support for the distribution.

2. We’d like to keep the world of Forgotten Colors alive creating unrevealed content such ‘The journal’ with Sketchbook and Making Off and the DVD ‘Off the record’.
The power of the crowd makes such an impact in this kind of Project. Your support will allow to produce a bigger quantity and therefore to get better prices for the printing and distribution.  For the same reason, we can also offer you better prices on the rewards.

(Look at the detailed funds distribution at the end of the project)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The book: A high quality piece of art limited and numbered.

This numbered edition of Forgotten Colors and other illustrated stories will only be available through Indiegogo, the author or the publisher. This art book, with more than 70 illustrations across 108 pages will measure 8,5x8,5 inches and it is printed in high quality paper with hardcover (check the 2 different editions below). Available in English and Spanish.

*A TRAVEL TO IMAGINATION TO BELIEVE IN REALITY AGAIN*

Fifteen stories with a great aftertaste. This book is about channeling your convictions to change the future, accepting differences, questioning received knowledge and about respecting others… and doing it with our biggest smile! The aim? To build a fairer, more compassionate and braver world.

‘Monday’s tale’, ‘Small pleasures’, ‘Imperfect future’ and ‘Make Laughter, make love’ are some of the suggesting titles. We also include the unrevealed tale The Guardian of Imagination that came into the world through the app with the same name, and extra content related to the stories such as Carmesina’s diary - You don’t already know her, but you’ll discover soon) - and The origins of it all - our story, how a desire became a book.

  you like it so, so, much that you’d like to have a special edition? Signed by the illustrators? We offer two different editions. Choose the one you like the most!
  • TRADE EDITION: 184-page hardcover art book, plus a giclée print.
  • LIFE & SOUL EDITION: deluxe hardcover book presented in slipcase, plus a limited edition giclée print.  – Limited to 300 perks.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Collector's Kit: the soul of this project

The all-time greats that inspired u are probably the same cultural models that left a mark on your childhood, youth, or even old age! In the Collector’s Kit you’ll find:

*The journal of Forgotten Colors (Sketchbook + Making Off)*
A high quality 5.83x8.27 inch 52-Page in cream-colored high-quality paper with trivia from the authors, where we share our worries, reflections, sketches and inspirations.

*Off the record*
A DVD which includes extra content such as a wallpaper collection with illustrations from the book - and other that you won't finde there - the original soundtrack by Teo Grimat, and many other surprises we’ll be revealing during this campaign.




Additional content that won't make you forget this project and you’ll discover why we did it (the well-known proverb about enjoying the way).

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Why you should collaborate

  1. You will get a moving and lovely illustrated art book with appealing stories that will awake the best version of youself.
  2. Furthermore you'll obtain extra bonuses created for this campaign, limited and only available now.
  3. Moreover you'll be supporting ordinary people to work in what we love and what makes us happy.
  4. And last but not least, you’ll be backing an exceptional project that encourages people to imagine new worlds, where nothing is granted and everything is possible.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The perks

We’ve created different perks so everybody, whatever your curiosity or implication in this project, may participate. Including limited rewards such as the book signed or dedicated by the illustrators, or even an original colored drawing.

All the perks include 'International Widespread shipping' (Check the 'International Shipping' section below for more details).

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

International Shipping

We offer two kinds of shipping: Widespread Shipping or Speedy Shipping.

  • Widespread Shipping: included in all the perks (Perks from $150 include the Speedy shipping). It takes from 15 days to 2 months, without tracking number.
    Read carefully: We cover the cost of this shipping, which is from 14$ to 19$ depending on the area. The delivery is under the responsibility of the Spanish Post office + your country’s post office.
  • Speedy Shipping: only included in the perks from $150. It takes from 5 to 15 days and it does have a tracking number. If you have contributed with a lower perk you can always add $15 extra and get the Speedy Shipping.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Funds distribution

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Who we are

Behind this project there are ordinary people, dreamers, with whom you probably share many more things than being citizens of the same planet.

In order of appearance: Carlos Ruiz (designer & Motion Graphics), Naiara Chaler (Project coordination & communication), Efrén Garcia (Team leader) David G. Forés (Illustrator) and Desiree Arancibia (Illustration & Support).

Credits of the project:
*Illustrated by David G. Forés with the inestimable help of Desiree Arancibia and Marta García, and the participation of Claudia Blin.
*Written by Silvia G. Guirado. Translated by M. baste-Kraan & C.S. Ord and revised by Kari Friedenson.
*Original soundtrack by Teo Grimalt.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Last message from the creators

If you like our project, please, share it! Sharing is caring. It is only way to let people know about this project and make it happen. How can you do it? Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest Carmesina or simply telling your friends about it.

Thanks a lot! :)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Risks and challenges

As always in this kind of projects the biggest challenge is to deliver the rewards. We have got experience in crowdfunding campaigns, such as Edgar Allan Poe illustrated: Ravings of love & death. This knowledge makes us confident in our ability to deliver the product properly. All the contributors from previous projects are absolutely happy with the product, specially with the quality and detailing of the rewards, which cheer us up to keep on doing great projects in which we believe.
