well-known proverb about enjoying the way).


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Why you should collaborate 





You will get a moving and
lovely illustrated art book with appealing stories that will awake the
best version of youself. 

Furthermore you'll obtain
extra bonuses created for this campaign, limited and only available now. 

Moreover you'll be supporting ordinary people to work in what we love and what makes us happy.
And last but not least, you’ll
be backing an exceptional project that encourages people to imagine new
worlds, where nothing is granted and everything is possible.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------






The perks 
 
We’ve created different perks so everybody, whatever your curiosity
or implication in this project, may participate. Including limited rewards such as the book signed or dedicated by the illustrators, or even an original colored drawing.All the perks include 'International Widespread shipping' (Check the 'International Shipping' section below for more details).---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


International Shipping
 

We offer two kinds of shipping:
Widespread Shipping or Speedy Shipping.



Widespread
Shipping: included in all the perks (Perks from $150 include the Speedy
shipping). It takes from 15 days to 2 months, without tracking number. Read carefully: We cover the cost of
this shipping, which is from 14$ to 19$ depending on the area. The delivery is
under the responsibility of the Spanish Post office + your country’s post
office.

Speedy
Shipping: only included in the perks from $150. It takes from 5 to 15
days and it does have a tracking number. If
you have contributed with a lower perk you can always add $15 extra and get the Speedy Shipping.



----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Funds distribution


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Who we are 
Behind this project there are
ordinary people, dreamers, with whom you probably share many more things than
being citizens of the same planet.In order of appearance: 
Carlos Ruiz (designer & Motion Graphics), Naiara Chaler 
(Project coordination & communication), Efrén Garcia (Team leader) David G. Forés 
(Illustrator) and Desiree 
Arancibia (Illustration & Support).
Credits of the project:*Illustrated by David G. Forés with the inestimable help of Desiree Arancibia and Marta García, and the participation of Claudia Blin.*Written by Silvia G. Guirado. Translated by M. baste-Kraan & C.S. Ord and revised by Kari Friedenson.*Original soundtrack by Teo Grimalt.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Last message from the creators 

If you like our project, please, share it! Sharing is caring. It is
only way to let people know about this project and make it happen. How can
you do it? Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest Carmesina or simply telling your friends about
it. 
Thanks a lot! :)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Risks and challenges

 As always in this kind of projects the biggest challenge is to deliver
the rewards. We have got experience in crowdfunding campaigns, such as Edgar Allan Poe illustrated: Ravings of love & death. This
knowledge makes us confident in our ability to deliver the product properly. All
the contributors from previous projects are absolutely happy with the product,
specially with the quality and detailing of the rewards, which cheer us up to
keep on doing great projects in which we believe.

story:
La Caja Comics. What's inside.

My name is Janine Carrington. I'm a Canadian artist who specializes in Comics and Children's illustration. I love making comics and telling life stories.  In 2008 I started a company making personalized comics called This is Your Life Stories.  I witnessed the great joy they brought to my clients. The success I achieved with this venture combined with the passing of my father led me to decide to start making stories to honour the dead and to help the bereaved through their difficult time. The result was La Caja Comics. 

 La Caja is Spanish for "The Box" and  is pronounced "LA KA HA" La Caja Comics are custom made celebration of Life Comics housed in a bespoke decorative box .

What's inside La CaJa?

La Caja Comics is a treasure chest where you'll find items created to tell and share the story of the deceased. The contents of La Caja include a hardcover volume with a thirty page graphic novel that tells the life story of the deceased. This hardcover volume also contains a photo scrapbook and transcription of the eulogy. La Caja also contains copies of an anecdote card that features a comic vignette which captures the spirit of the protagonist, Along side these items are illustrated wallet sized portraits, soft cover copies of the graphic novel and a 16 GB dual micro/standard USB keychain with the digital files for re-printing sharing and social media. All rights to the story belong to the patron which means it can be reprinted and sold to raise funds for the deceased's favourite cause. 

Why La Caja?

After losing a loved one we seek a way to honour the cherished person we've lost and we seek a way to find solace. Storytelling through a comic is an excellent but practically unheard of way to do this.

The comic I created for my father brought me the solace I craved. After it was printed I slept with it in my hand and read it over and over until the emotion subsided and I was able to function again. 

The comic also helped me pay tribute to him through others. It allowed me to honour him by sharing his legacy. I created a story that accentuated his positive traits and talents. Gifting this cute story that would  be read, shared and cherished actually brought a bit of joy to one of the saddest times of my life. Joy in the real belief that every time someone read it for a few glorious minutes he came back to life again.  

My hope in creating these stories is that not only the people who grieve will read them, but that they in turn will share them and remember the deceased as the years go by. 

With this campaign we will bring La Caja Comics into the places where grieving families go to plan their final goodbye. Families dealing with devastating grief may find great comfort in creating such a meaningful tribute.  But because the creation of a comic is such an unusual service most people don't know that such an option is available and in such a heavy time most will not be in a frame of mind to research something new.  Through this campaign we will bring La Caja comics to the trusted places where families go to say their final goodbye i.e. funeral homes, crematories, funeral directors, morticians, funeral planners. As well this campaign will help to increase La Caja Comics' visibility online in order to gently and respectfully reach out to families who do find themselves researching new options for tributes.

 

Why will the departed by missed?

 

 

But it's more important than just us. 

Comics have a special power in that they are easily consumed. Everyone has a time for beautiful images and a little bit of text. And the combination of words and pictures is a great way to get a message across. We can use this power for something very good (not evil).  Because La Caja Comics are about real people and because the stories are very easily consumed La Caja comics shape the future by providing us and the generations that come after us examples of the good every member of the human race is capable of. With every positive inspirational true story that comes into existence by way of La Caja Comics the world receives the gift of the truth.

I see a world with a La Caja comic in every home and on every device. A world where children are as familiar with their phenomenal ancestors story as they are with their favourite YouTube character. The more La Caja comics there are, the more positive our societies become. We will provide our descendants with documentation of the greatness of their ancestors. We give them a sense of pride in their heritage through the true story of the greatness that came before them.  A story they will enjoy reading.

 

Which brings me to the reason for this campaign.

No matter how little or much is contributed, every dollar raised by this campaign puts us one step further towards this future.

Ideally I'm looking to raise $65 000 USD. This will be used for spreading the word to the funeral industry and developing an online digital library to house La Caja Comics.

50% of the funds raised to go towards my attendance at 12 trade shows over the course of one year where I will present La Caja Comics as an available service. Trade shows are a super effective way of presenting La Caja to the most amount of interested people in the least amount of time. 

The nature of La Caja comics is very visual and the product is exhibited to its best advantage in person.  My attendance at tradeshows will give me the opportunity to present the final product with all its elements in the best possible light.

20% of funds raised will go towards printing of marketing materials and the expenses associated with a traditional marketing campaign. In addition to trade shows I'll also engage in traditional marketing campaign where I'll reach out to funeral homes via telephone or presentations and distribute literature (brochures and copies of my father's comic "Carrington"). 

15% of funds will go towards increasing La Caja's visibility on Google, Bing, Yahoo, and other popular search Engines. Increasing visibility without being insensitive and predatory towards families in an emotionally vulnerable state is a task best left to a marketing expert. I will hire someone who can achieve a high ranking on Google and other search engines and avoid using aggressive advertising techniques.

$1500 of the funds I would like to allocate to the creation of a digital library to house the stories so that they  are accessible to the world at large. The creation of the La Caja Comic universe.

$2000 of the funds raised will go towards the development of a more basic versions similar to the perks available of La Caja that will be more accessible to families with a smaller budget.


The Perks

My hope is as well through the perks backers will get the chance to experience the benefits of welcoming La Caja Comics into their homes. 

This is not as morbid as it sounds!

Although La Caja Comics are created to help with the grieving process they are not limited to the recently deceased. There are many occasions where a La Caja comic would make an excellent complement. Namely the anniversary of the passing, family reunions, holidays or just to something to have to share with visitors who come for coffee. Backers will have exclusive access to smaller versions of a La Caja comic that are not generally available as well as the opportunity to receive the beautiful bespoke full version of the La Caja with decorative box at a discounted rate and preferential treatment. 

In Summary...

Any amount of funding I receive will go to good use. Approximately $20 000-$65,000  will be needed to participate in a useful amount of trade shows and accomplish the rest of my objectives. 

However, if the minimum for tradeshows is not met the funds will go towards traditional and internet marketing efforts, the creation of the digital library and new products. Any amount contributed will guaranteed, help immensely with these important efforts.

If I receive backing that exceeds my goal the funds will go towards amplifying my efforts to spread the word about La Caja Comics and the benefits they bring. 

A stretch goal of $120,000 will allow me to hire two employees to help fulfill orders and expand into the Spanish speaking world. 

There are some risks involved. The risks are related to the fulfillment of orders. With my company This is Your Life Stories in the beginning due to a group buying campaign I found myself overwhelmed by orders. In the ten years that followed that event I've learned a lot about properly scheduling work and realistic time frames. I've also had the chance to connect with helper artists and graphic designers who will help me realize every La Caja Comics commission. 

If you've gotten this far in the description it's safe to assume your interest is peaked which makes me very glad. I encourage you to have a look at the perks and see if there's anything that you might want to take advantage of. And even if you can't contribute financially at this time it doesn't mean you can't help. Spread the word! Use the Indiegogo share tools! Let potential backers know this is happening. Tell everyone you know!  If that's the most you can do then that's enough and I thank you from the bottom of my heart.

With gratitude and hope here we go!

story:
Here're some of the Reviews...

You can check out a Preview of the book below - and then we'll say Hello to our creative team! :)


Hey, what say we meet the Creators now...?



Sam Johnson is a British comics writer/editor. Sam has a Masters in Creative Writing for Film & TV and has been working in comics for ten years. Among this work, he created Cabra Cini: Voodoo Junkie Hitwoman, which had a strip annually in the Halloween issue of H!M Comics' IF-X anthology; he has self-published two The Almighties one-shots (a comedy super-team co-created with Mike Gagnon); released the first 4-issue Geek-Girl Mini-Series through publisher Markosia monthly from Nov 2016, and ran a successful Kickstarter for its TPB.

Sam's favorite comic and biggest influence is DC's super-team book, Doom Patrol – Grant Morrison's bizarre run back in the day - now successfully returned under My Chemical Romance's Gerard Way.



Colombian Carlos Granda is Geek-Girl's artist. His previous work includes Grimm Fairy tales, The Jungle Book, Heroes of Home Room C (which was successfully funded on Kickstarter) and Pirouette. Besides handling his own workload, Carlos is co-director of The National Comic & Manga Hall and FICCO - groups dedicated to nurturing and exhibiting the artwork of local creators in Medellin www.artstation.com/grandacomicfan



Geek-Girl Colorist Chunlin Zhao lives in Sichuan, China. She has been coloring and illustrating comics since 2012, working on such comics as Wretches, The Misadventures of Electrolyte, and Shogun Knight Dyson V - for publishers including Oddworld, Jackalope and Outland Entertainment.

Geek-Girl's letterer Paul McLaren started off drawing comics as a kid, with his school friend and fellow Scotsman Mark Millar (Kick-Ass, Kingsman, Secret Service) - though went on to have a career in the police. He left the Police Service to work in the Middle East as an Explosive Detection Dog Handler in the private security industry but then (as you do) got back into the comic scene in 2008, when he lettered a small 6 page project called "Camouflage" written by Martin Conaghan (Fallen Heroes), later lettering Martin's Graphic Novel Burke and Hare.

He now works on a number of projects for various publishers, and his most recent have been comics for the Unseen Shadows Universe,(www.unseenshadows.net) and a Graphic Novel about the life of Aleister Crowley.

Risks and challenges

The new Geek-Girl #4 is the eighth Geek-Girl comic the creative team have worked together on now, and it also marks Geek-Girl becoming an ongoing series. The issue is already completed, is being produced by the same reliable printer we have used for the previous issues, and we can say with certainty will be in delivered in March 2018. Your backing will go towards funding the NEXT Geek-Girl story arc! :)

story:
BRIC-A-BRAC IS BACK!!!

We were able to fund the first twenty-five-page issue of BRIC-A-BRAC last Fall and now we're coming back to fund the ENTIRE (80+ PAGE) GRAPHIC NOVEL! Yes, PART ONE and PART TWO will be combined to create this graphic novel!

This is the optimal way to experience the immersive BAB universe and story!

Planet Christmas is at WAR! General Almond and his soldiers have used secret alien technology to take over the home of thousands of peaceful Christmas creatures! Although the good people of Planet Christmas have formed a militia to defend their livelihoods, the Nutcracker army is too powerful! No one is safe and there are enemies on both sides!

Last time, we joined our heroes Garret and Marie on their epic quest to find Father Christmas! Along the way, General Almond and his bother General Tchaikovsky created a whole bunch of trouble for the two! But there are so many more dangers that will be presented to our two heroes as the story continues! 

They will meet Jack Frost, The Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present, and Future, and Good King Wenceslas and so many others on their journey! 

In addition to the main story (70+ pages) written by Ryan Haack and drawn by Rafael Sam, there will also be a five-page back-up story called "The Tragedy of Jack Frost" in the graphic novel. This short comic story will be drawn by Tom Barton, the same incredible artist who drafted our great covers!

Tom and I previously worked on a short comic story called "Cereal Wars" a couple of years ago. We loved it so much we  made it into a motion comic (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FzTeCXzgPcE). If you think this is good, get ready for another great story based in the BRIC-A-BRAC universe! 

So, we're funding an epic 70+ graphic novel! Since I've run and fulfilled two crowd-funding campaigns since July 2019, I know I can deliver on this one--but nailing the economics is critical. In case you wanted to know where some of your contributions are going, I made a little pie chart! We also added an extra thousand for IGG costs and other unexpected costs!

My name is RYAN HAACK and I'm the creator and writer of BRIC-A-BRAC! Since I was a little kid, I was fascinated by Christmas and all the lore surrounding it! I loved the imagery, the decorations, the holiday specials, and I still do to this day! BRIC-A-BRAC is my attempt at creating a story that can show adults and children how valuable and important Christmas is as a concept! It's an incredibly useful holiday with ideals and values which we can implement in every single day of our lives! I am so passionate about this story and had an absolute BLAST writing in the dramatic, fun, and always exciting world that is BRIC-A-BRAC!

 

RAFAEL SAM: Born in São Paulo, and raised in Recife (PE), Rafael Sam has worked as a freelance illustrator and comic artist for 9 years. He has worked in the area of textbooks and also comic books, in cartoon style, concept art, and has made scenes for animations. Some time ago, he worked for DreamWorks Animation's comics division, where he made 3 editions of the Madagascar title. He recently worked on the catharsis-funded Black Desert author project where he made the official launch at ccxp 2018. His Instagram is @rafael1234hc. 

 

TOM BARTON: 

Tom’s been working as an illustrator for the last 5 years. He’s done several comics, including a short webcomic series for League of Legends called “Olaf Vs Everything”. His biggest influences are the likes of Joe Madureira, Chris Bachalo, and Ed McGuinness. When he’s not working on comics, he’s coming up with character designs, concept art, and writing his own stories. His Instagram is @tomo_tron

He’s done several comics, including a short webcomic series for League of Legends called “Olaf Vs Everything”. His biggest influences are the likes of Joe Madureira, Chris Bachalo, and Ed McGuinness. When he’s not working on comics, he’s coming up with character designs, concept art, and writing his own stories. His Instagram is @tomo_tron

story:
The Story Continues in FALLEN #2

FALLEN #2 is a 22 page, full colour second issue of an ongoing series printed on standard American sized comic format on high quality paper.  Fallen will blend the genres of mystery, thriller and fantasy by creating a thrilling mythological detective story. The story takes place in the vibrant, synth-pop filled era of the 1980's in the loud, crowded streets of New York City. 

  Where we left with FALLEN #1, the Godfather himself Zeus was murdered right in front of his ward Casper Clay. The criminal world of deities was sent reeling at the news of an immortal god being taken out. While the Greek family is scrambling to react, Casper's life is sent spiraling as he is expelled from his previous life and exiled from the world he once served...

Who Will Like FALLEN?

Obviously fans of the first book will really enjoy this one but if you're just getting on board now and you like any of these things, you're going to love FALLEN;

80's Pop Culture - FALLEN is inspired by and infused with a lot of the 80's classics from music,  movies and style.

Mythology - Doesn't matter if you're a fan of Greek, Norse or any other mythology, FALLEN is going to touch on it all.

Crime Thriller - If you're intrigued by stories of crime, murder and mystery. It's like a mash up of John Wick, Constantine and Clash of the Titans.

FALLEN is inspired by neo-noire stories like Blade Runner, Blade Runner 2049 and fantasy stories like Fables and The Wolf Among Us.

Press:

"FALLEN provides a new spin on an old tale and does it by infusing the story with dirt, grime, and some godly magic. FALLEN is a must-read for lovers of mythology, crime dramas, or well-constructed comics." -  Monkeys Fighting Robots 

"If you enjoyed Hercules or The Odyssey (the Poem and subsequent 90s mini-series) – then you’ll lap up what this comic book has in store for you." -  Soda and Telepaths 

 

Rewards

 

Preview:

 

Issue 1 Cover

Issue 1 Variant Cover

Issue 1 Page 1

Issue 1 Page 2

Issue 1 Page 3

Issue 1 Page 4

Issue 2 Cover

Issue 2 Page 1 (black and white)

Issue 2 Page 2 (black and white)

Issue 2 Page 3 (black and white)

Creative Team:

The team has stayed the same with the three of us still passionately working on the series;

Matt: Creator and Writer of FALLEN. Matt has been working on the concept for the story for over 2 years. It was originally developed for a comic format and then  considered making it a novel. As Matt continued writing, the imagery that he wanted to convey would only be given justice in the colourful pages of a comic. 

 Henry: Henry is a talented and professional artist based out of the Philippines. He is a published Graphic Novel Artist on books like Children's Vampire Hunting Brigade volume 1&2, Alterna Comics Tinsel Town, The Devil Within, Seven Legions and various contributions on anthologies. To see more of his work visit:  https://www.artstation.com/henryponciano 

 Toben:  Toben Racicot writes and letters comics. He’s worked on Beastlands, The Wild Cosmos, Thorn Squadron, Menagerie, and Rumble Kings. Together with his wife, Alaire Racicot they created Crown & Anchor, the fantasy sci-fi pirate adventure. He also runs multiple Dungeons & Dragons campaigns and continues the hunt in Bloodborne, and is taking parenting lessons from Kratos as he plays God of War (2018). He’s also working on a PhD in Role Playing Games and Adaptation Theory at the University of Waterloo. To see more of his work visit: artstation.com/letterdrone

Budget

Timeline

Here is the projected timeline for the project;

IndieGoGo Campaign: June - July 

IndieGoGo funds received: End of July  (approx)

Artwork completed: November-December 2020

Book manufacturing and freight: December 2020

Shipping of rewards: December 2020

Risks and challenges

This is my second crowdfunding campaign after my first one is successful. The risks are relatively low for this one. I learned quite a bit from the last one and plan on applying my experience to streamline the process and speed up production. The script is 100% complete and the artwork is 25% complete. One of the issues I had with the last campaign was the printing service I used had a hard time getting the shipments through customs in a timely manner and added some huge delays to the project. The new service I switched to, and will be using on this one is extremely fast and will cut down the wait time for books by months.

story:
Wanna Grab Some Free Comics???

Get Issues 1 & 2 for FREE right HERE!!! Download Issues 1 & 2 TODAY & Join Us & The Secret Protectors on this awesome adventure! 

 

 

Fresh Off The Back Of Our Successful Kickstarter Campaign!

Here's the opportunity for those who missed out to pick themselves up a copy of The Secret Protectors - Volume 1!

What do you mean you don't know who we are!?!

We're kidding, of course! We're new to Indiegogo! So who are we & who are The Secret Protectors?

This is a joint work between writer and creator Adam Wheeler and artist and co-creator Ben Nunn. Our story is probably a bit different to the norm. We met back in 2017 and through our joint love of all things comics, anime, manga, story and film we began working on an epic story of our own! Part of the inspiration for our story is the way, historically, comics have not always focused on fully developing Black, Asian and female characters. Don't get us wrong here, we're not trying to make any statement, we just wanted to tell an inclusive story with a diverse cast of characters that everyone can get behind. For reference, think old-school Chris Claremont X-Men.

So, That's Us! But What About The Comic?

Let us set the scene!

The year is 1982, on the surface, this Earth shares many similarities to our own. However, here, a single man's actions have altered the world forever. Unbeknownst to all but a few, humanity is in perilous danger. The Secret Protectors must put their differences aside, join forces and put an end to this looming menace. A conflict thousands of years in the making is coming to a head.

Following the loss of his father in a believed freak accident, Benjamin Banks, a twenty-year-old Kansas-native who is unaware of this secret war, finds himself imbued with incredible powers and thrust into this global conflict. Aligned with The Secret Protectors and working outside of the law for a single purpose; to stop the U.S. based clandestine organisation S.C.I.M.I.T.A.R or The Supreme Command for Incident Management & Initial Tactical Armed Response!

The pressure on both sides to succeed is unimaginable and the plot weaves between all the major players from both The Secret Protectors and The Forces of S.C.I.M.I.T.A.R

So, it's a superhero comic then?

Yes and no! Our story contains science-fiction & fantasy elements but also a good deal of world building and intrigue. In this series we look to delve beneath the simple themes of Good vs. Evil, examining the grey areas between them. These characters are not perfect, they are not Gods nor are they genius millionaires. They are simply people attempting to make the right call when it counts. These are human characters with flaws and complex histories that put them into conflict with each other when deciding how to act. The one thing they absolutely do know however, is that their world's fate is in their hands!

From Adam - Writer & Creator

"I love the medium of comics; the ability to build and showcase amazing worlds and characters through not only words and narrative but also imagery has always sparked my imagination. For as long as I can remember I have had this story playing out in mind. Over the years it's developed and evolved into the basis of what would become our story - The Secret Protectors."

From Ben - Artist & Co-Creator

"Adam contacted me via a website sometime around mid-2017, with the idea for a comic book he was looking to develop. He thought my art style would suit the world he envisaged. Turns out Adam and I only lived like 10 minutes down the road from one another. As we discussed and debated the idea it kind of grew into this sprawling new world full with rich story-telling potential. It's a project I knew I had to be part of! Although this is our second campaign, with the completion of Volume 1 I feel like this is the culmination of this years long journey."

We are both so remarkably proud of what we have achieved with the series. We can't wait to bring you more from the world of The Secret Protectors! The party is just starting!

What's Our Goal?

Well, we're already funded! We hit our goal on our recent Kickstarter, which you can find HERE! So, our funding goal here is flexible! We want to get our comic into as many readers hands and hearts as possible! We love our story and this world that we've created! Join us on this adventure! Have we got your backing?

 

Pump The Brakes! Tell Me More!

Okay, okay... Tell you what! We'll do you one better! Try us out for free! Sign up HERE! and receive Issues 1 & 2 completely for FREE! It's okay, we'll still be here when you get back. 

 

What's Included In Volume 1 Then?

This is going to be one meaty book (Though it will contain no actual meat content)! We haven't finished our final page count just yet as we're looking to add some extra behind the scenes content for you, but, it's looking like it's going to be around 140 pages! At least 106 pages of which is story!

What Extras?

Oh we've got it coming out of the Wazoo! Back to the subject of the comic though! Here's what you can expect:

Foreword - By Adam Wheeler (Don't worry, I'll keep it brief)

Fan Art Corner - The return of our Fan Art section! (Open to everyone! Got fan art? We want it! Send it to us and we'll put the best ones Volume 1). Please contact us either here our via email with your fan art submissions. (Open to all ages & artistic ability).

The S.C.I.M.I.T.A.R Dossier Files - Top Secret files straight from the desk of Commander Grey. Our heroes better watch out!

Concept Art Pages - We, previously included some concept art in our Special Edition of Issue 1, the feedback we got was amazing so we're going to be extending this section to bring you even more of it!

Behind The Panel - Ben is going to give away his tricks of the trade and show how he goes from turning Adam's scripts into full blown inked, coloured and lettered pages. You do not want to miss out on this!

Who is this comic for? Who's going to enjoy it?

Fans of Superheroes and fans of Sci-fi & fantasy, however, with that said we haven't necessarily written this story with any particular demographic in mind. We've had great feedback from adults and children alike. Our story doesn't rely on extreme violence or gratuitous nudity. We wanted to tell an archetypal story, something wholesome yet still entertaining and thought-provoking. Hopefully we've struck that chord and got that balance. Don't just take our word for it though, check out some of this praise we've received!

You can also watch Writer & Creator Adam Wheeler talk with YouTuber Comico Deano about the comic HERE!

Because we're already funded this campaign offers a second chance for readers to pick up our comic! Thus this campaign is completely flexible! Our comic is done! We'll be getting it printed very soon!

We've got loads of other cool merch too so check out what we've got to offer!

 

Risks & Challenges

We're confident that we've taken all things into account! Although this is our first campaign on Indiegogo we've just completed our second Kickstarter campaign for The Secret Protectors comic.

Our first campaign was a really good learning opportunity for us. Overall the campaign went very smoothly. All backers received their rewards within the allotted time frame. We really appreciate and value the opportunity that crowdfunding platforms & communities provide to indie creators like ourselves. The faith and trust demonstrated by backer after backer to amazing projects from all around the world is something that truly inspires us. With that in mind we feel completely obligated to ensure that our campaign is smooth and successful. We’ve already hit our target! This is about getting our comic into even more peoples hands!

 

We've done all that we can think of to ensure the risks and challenges of delivering to our backers is minimised to the smallest of margins. The last thing we want is for your rewards to arrive in less than pristine condition so Postage & Packaging is something we've also put a lot of thought into. For that reason every shipped comic will come in a sealed bag with a backing board. Our envelopes will also be card backed to ensure the comic arrives in pristine condition. For posters and other artwork we have poster tubes to keep the work protected. Our other merchandise and rewards have all been sourced, my cupboard is bursting. Essentially everything is set and ready to go! Essentially, we've got it all sorted! We wouldn't want to begin our campaign until everything was set and good to go! If you have any questions about the campaign then please contact us at thesecretprotectors@gmail.com – we’ll reply as soon as we can and we'd love to hear from you.

 

Thanks for Reading Our Page, Stay Heroic!

Adam & Ben

story:
Storm riders is an adrenaline rush, full of action, suspense, mystery and speed!

With lots of comedy too!   But this story isn't just about that ...

It’s about chasing dreams.

Difficulties, disappointments and tears that lead those who persevere to the goal.

Get to the fulfillment of the most coveted desire!  

This is what STORM RIDERS is about!

     This series was written exploring original and very exciting topics! If you're a speed lover, or even just simply curious, you will love these comics, because you will escape from routine and from repeatedly used themes! It's a different kind of reading, for you who want to escape from the classic comics!

  The goal is to continue producing the series and providing quality and original comics, and above all this, it will add beauty to the day of those who support us!

     The series tells the story of Emil, a young dancer who during his childhood was a promise in youth motorcycling.

      After the death of his grandfather, Emil is forced to get back on the bike, to be able to finance his great childhood dream. 

Become the greatest dancer in his country!

      Parallel to Emil‘s the story of Mary is told — or as she is better known on the circuits, "Blood mary"! A very proud professional rider, who is defeated in a road race by a mysterious biker in black, called the Ghost-rider!

      This legendary biker, who is believed by many to be just an urban legend, is so fast that he seems to come from the other world!

This is why it is called so.

Rematch for Mary becomes an obsession... until her path meets Emil's!

In addition to theirs, there are many other interesting characters, such as Marleen, a very grouchy motorcycle mechanic, or Rusty Jack, an unstoppable and unfortunate womanizer!

The story takes place on several continents, and all the roads and places are real! the plot is about overcoming and sacrifice, to reach the goals! An engaging and motivating reading!

      The first episode of STORM RIDERS counts a total of forty pages. While the cover and special illustrations are in high definition color, the interior is reticulated black and white, similar to modern Japanese comics. The comic book Is already in the works, and will soon be ready to be sent!


Cover 1



 


 

Ghost Rider

 The comic will be available in print and digital format. For digital versions, the available format is PDF, while the printed version uses the POD system, available through a collaboration with Drive Thru Comics (www.drivethrucomics.com).

POD-Print on demand code: You will receive a print on demand code that will allow you to order a physical copy of the comic, paying only the print cost and shipping specific to your shipping location.

     In the printed version, we initially established the 6.14 "x 9.21" soft cover as the format. However, if we manage to beat the necessary stretch goals, it will also be available in a hard cover version!


     Absolutely yes!

  Although the story happens into a motorcycle context, it's about much more than just racing and speed!

You will find captivating characters, and intense stories of friendship, perseverance, love and dreams! Also, this comic is written in a simple way, so that people without a high knowledge of motorcycle racing can read and learn about this world!


It is very similar to the thanks list! But with a different function!

The Advertising Partners area is reserved for those who help us to advertise the campaign! Anyone, even without supporting the campaign, can participate!

Just contact us in the email stormriderscomics@gmail.com by sending us the social network in which you advertised us, and you will be included in the list together with your name in the network in which you advertised us!

by doing so you will help us to introduce Storm Riders! and in return we'll advertise your profile in the comic!

(Instagram / Facebook: the options are a post, or stories, otherwise a reel!)

 


 

     Here are the rewards and how their delivery works! 

Choose what you like the best!

PRINTED VERSION — If you choose this reward it is because you want the printed version of volume 1 of Storm riders!

The comic's POD (printing on demand) code will arrive! Just access the website www.drivethrucomics.com, enter the code with your address and you will soon have your comic in your hands! The shipping cost is charged on the drive thru comics website and not on kickstarter (calculable on the drive thru comics website)  together with only the cost for printing ( US- 2.89$, UK-2.11£ . It may undergo slight variations depending on the desired printing date). If the campaign reaches more than 100 backers in the "stretch goals", you may have more PODs with cover versions to choose from!


 

 

DIGITAL VERSION—   If you have chosen this reward, the Storm Riders volume 1 webcomic will arrive directly in your email, and you can easily read it on your favorite device! The reading format is PDF. Also, if the campaign reaches more than 100 supporters, two versions with different covers will arrive directly, along with the other unlocked stretch goals!


 

 

THANKS LIST—At the end of the comic, both digital and printed, there will be a special thanks with a list of the names of all the supporters of this project. If you're a part of it too, the best way to thank you is to do it publicly! For this we put your name in the thanks list !!!



 

 

BECOME A CAMEO CHARACTER— Oh yes!    You read that right! 

By choosing this reward, you will be able to be part of the story as a cameo character !! it means your drawn version will appear on one of the pages!

After the campaign you will send us your photo or the name of your instagram or facebook profile. From these references we will create your character design in the comic!

This reward obviously has a very limited number, so run to choose it!

   

      Should we exceed the estimate of backers that we think will participate in the campaign, we have some extra rewards to add to thank you for your support!

 

 

 If we get to 50 backers, as a thank you we will send everyone a series of exclusive smartphone wallpapers for those who supported us on kickstarter!

 

 

      Getting to one hundred backers would be great! Should that happen, to commemorate we will develop a second cover to choose from especially for this campaign!

 

 

 woaaa!!!

 If we get that far, we can unlock the hardcover option for our supporters !!! 

In addition, for those who choose the digital version we will develop a super digital poster as a thank you with the brand of 150 backers!  Or maybe even more!

Heart attack!!! 

That would be truly wonderful!

Should that happen, we'll add five pages of a Chibi-style comic story to see a big smile on your face!

 

 

      The strong point of this project is the originality of the story! Designers avoid this type of theme because of the difficulty of repeatedly designing cars and motorcycles! It really is not easy, but it is done with dedication and passion! By supporting this project, you reward the effort to bring new possibilities to the public in the world of comics, and keep this series up!

Thanks for you support!

 

 

.

.

.


The comic is almost ready! Once the campaign is over, we should only develop the stretch goals and enter who wants to participate as an "extra character" in the appropriate pages! For the digital version, after a very short time it will arrive in your hands! For the printed version we rely on Drive Thru comics, which is present both in the Americas and in Europe, making it much easier to ship all over the world!
story_txt: Storm riders is an adrenaline rush, full of action, suspense, mystery and speed!With lots of comedy too!   But this story isn't just about that ...It’s about chasing dreams.Difficulties, disappointments and tears that lead those who persevere to the goal.Get to the fulfillment of the most coveted desire!  This is what STORM RIDERS is about!     This series was written exploring original and very exciting topics! If you're a speed lover, or even just simply curious, you will love these comics, because you will escape from routine and from repeatedly used themes! It's a different kind of reading, for you who want to escape from the classic comics!  The goal is to continue producing the series and providing quality and original comics, and above all this, it will add beauty to the day of those who support us!     The series tells the story of Emil, a young dancer who during his childhood was a promise in youth motorcycling.      After the death of his grandfather, Emil is forced to get back on the bike, to be able to finance his great childhood dream. Become the greatest dancer in his country!      Parallel to Emil‘s the story of Mary is told — or as she is better known on the circuits, "Blood mary"! A very proud professional rider, who is defeated in a road race by a mysterious biker in black, called the Ghost-rider!      This legendary biker, who is believed by many to be just an urban legend, is so fast that he seems to come from the other world!This is why it is called so.Rematch for Mary becomes an obsession... until her path meets Emil's!In addition to theirs, there are many other interesting characters, such as Marleen, a very grouchy motorcycle mechanic, or Rusty Jack, an unstoppable and unfortunate womanizer!The story takes place on several continents, and all the roads and places are real! the plot is about overcoming and sacrifice, to reach the goals! An engaging and motivating reading!      The first episode of STORM RIDERS counts a total of forty pages. While the cover and special illustrations are in high definition color, the interior is reticulated black and white, similar to modern Japanese comics. The comic book Is already in the works, and will soon be ready to be sent!Cover 1  Ghost Rider The comic will be available in print and digital format. For digital versions, the available format is PDF, while the printed version uses the POD system, available through a collaboration with Drive Thru Comics (www.drivethrucomics.com).POD-Print on demand code: You will receive a print on demand code that will allow you to order a physical copy of the comic, paying only the print cost and shipping specific to your shipping location.     In the printed version, we initially established the 6.14 "x 9.21" soft cover as the format. However, if we manage to beat the necessary stretch goals, it will also be available in a hard cover version!     Absolutely yes!  Although the story happens into a motorcycle context, it's about much more than just racing and speed!You will find captivating characters, and intense stories of friendship, perseverance, love and dreams! Also, this comic is written in a simple way, so that people without a high knowledge of motorcycle racing can read and learn about this world!It is very similar to the thanks list! But with a different function!The Advertising Partners area is reserved for those who help us to advertise the campaign! Anyone, even without supporting the campaign, can participate!Just contact us in the email stormriderscomics@gmail.com by sending us the social network in which you advertised us, and you will be included in the list together with your name in the network in which you advertised us!by doing so you will help us to introduce Storm Riders! and in return we'll advertise your profile in the comic!(Instagram / Facebook: the options are a post, or stories, otherwise a reel!)       Here are the rewards and how their delivery works! Choose what you like the best!PRINTED VERSION — If you choose this reward it is because you want the printed version of volume 1 of Storm riders!The comic's POD (printing on demand) code will arrive! Just access the website www.drivethrucomics.com, enter the code with your address and you will soon have your comic in your hands! The shipping cost is charged on the drive thru comics website and not on kickstarter (calculable on the drive thru comics website)  together with only the cost for printing ( US- 2.89$, UK-2.11£ . It may undergo slight variations depending on the desired printing date). If the campaign reaches more than 100 backers in the "stretch goals", you may have more PODs with cover versions to choose from!  DIGITAL VERSION—   If you have chosen this reward, the Storm Riders volume 1 webcomic will arrive directly in your email, and you can easily read it on your favorite device! The reading format is PDF. Also, if the campaign reaches more than 100 supporters, two versions with different covers will arrive directly, along with the other unlocked stretch goals!  THANKS LIST—At the end of the comic, both digital and printed, there will be a special thanks with a list of the names of all the supporters of this project. If you're a part of it too, the best way to thank you is to do it publicly! For this we put your name in the thanks list !!!  BECOME A CAMEO CHARACTER— Oh yes!    You read that right! By choosing this reward, you will be able to be part of the story as a cameo character !! it means your drawn version will appear on one of the pages!After the campaign you will send us your photo or the name of your instagram or facebook profile. From these references we will create your character design in the comic!This reward obviously has a very limited number, so run to choose it!         Should we exceed the estimate of backers that we think will participate in the campaign, we have some extra rewards to add to thank you for your support!   If we get to 50 backers, as a thank you we will send everyone a series of exclusive smartphone wallpapers for those who supported us on kickstarter!        Getting to one hundred backers would be great! story:
The Story:

Xander is a single issue story that takes place inside the Skylin Universe. It focuses on the young Prince as he goes from carefree surfer to doing what is necessary to protect his people from a Pirate invasion. In a world filled with Dragons, Wizards and Beasts, what could possibly go wrong?

If you support this campaign you can walk away with Xander and so much more. We even are offering an exclusive Indiegogo Variant Cover of Xander #01, only 100 will ever be printed of that specific Cover.  Also we have tiers with all of our books included (both digitally and physically) to keep you reading for a while!

 

What We Need:

The book is complete and the only thing left to do is print. We're hoping to secure enough funding to send Xander to the printer. We have chosen the printer and the files are ready. We just need your support to make it happen. We've created some rewards that we believe you will like and we tried to put as much value in each reward as possible. Xander is a beautifully illustrated book with a story that will keep you on the edge of your seat. 

 

4 Preview Pages, enjoy !

 

Charon Comics:

Included in some tiers are our other books. Skylin 1 & 2, Sol Survivor and our Tale of Charon Anthology book. Skylin #1 won fantasy book of the year for 2017 on ComixCentral and we just sent Skylin 02 to the printer. Sol Survivor is our flagship series, the story centers around the last surviving human, who is seeking revenge against the alien empire that is responsible for the genocide of the human race. Last but not least, Tales of Charon is a 70+ page anthology book with a bunch of short stories and a comic strip for you to enjoy. Supporting our campaign means you can walk away with Xander plus a physical copy of all these books shown below! 

 

 

 

The Impact

What your contribution means for us:

  • We will be able to bring Xander to all of our conventions.
  • We've run two successful crowdfunding campaigns and this will allow us to continue to bring our backers more and more high quality books.
  • The Skylin Universe will have a brand-new book to help flush out the world we've created. 

Risks & Challenges

Risk is very minimal here. Not only is the book finished but the files are ready. We know through experience how to run a successful crowdfunding campaign and deliver exactly what we promised. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you like what you see, please consider pledging to this campaign. 
  • Using Indiegogo's share tools can help get the word out socially.

story:
Short Summary

Gone are the days when you can go to your local pharmacy and find spinner racks full of the latest comic books. How does this impact the lives of youth? Rural America no longer has that stepping on point for young minds to be entranced and excited by the combination of art and writing. As a young man, I was captivated by the stories in the pages of Spider-man and Action Comics. Comic books filled that gap between children’s books and more adult literature and forced me to learn the correlation between spelling and pronunciation of words that the public school system wouldn't address until later in my education. In short, it broadened my mind and expanded my imagination. 

  • We're a family owned business. We're two brothers who grew up with a love of comic books. We'd buy books wherever we could find them. All those places that don't have comic books now, the local drug store, the nearest convenience store, I mean anywhere!
  • This is our chance to give back to an industry that was integral to our childhood.
  • You can help us make comic books available to so many people in the continental United States.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Our $2,500 goal is going to be split down the middle. Half of the funds will be used as capital to fund inventory for the subscription service as we get it off the ground. The remainder will be spent for promotion online and as many comic book conventions as we can feasibly attend to get the word out.
  • Get all your subscriptions in one place, Marvel, DC, Image, and all the independents.
  • It's all or nothing at this point. If we don't meet our goal, your contribution will be refunded. If we do meet our goal, perks will begin June 3rd.

The Impact

Our goal at Pop Culture Emporium is simple. We seek to bring comic books back to the masses, back to those young minds who may never find their way to a specialty comic book retailer who may be miles away from their homes. 

  • Comic books should be easier to obtain for everyone who's not in striking distance of a specialty comic book shop. Let us make that goal a reality.
  • If a title loses you (and let's face it sometimes they do), then cancel your subscription. We'll be more than happy to issue a pro-rated discount for the remainder of the subscription term.
  • Select your own shipping terms. Have your books shipped weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly to control your shipping costs.

Risks & Challenges

Any new venture is risky. We've been working up to this step by selling comic book back issues online for over two years. Customer service has been our number one focus and it's allowed us to sell throughout North America and around the globe. 

  • We've been developing our website from the beginning of our company over two years ago with this goal in mind. 
  • Customer service has been and will remain our top priority.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's slow going to build up to the point where we can make a real and palpable impact on an industry that has shirked the bulk of the retailers that would make comic books accessible to most consumers. That's were YOU can help. If you're not in a position to make a monetary contribution right now, then share our campaign in every way you can!

  • Share, share, and share again. Share our campaign on Facebook, on Twitter, and on any other form of social media you can think of. Tell your friends, tell your family!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What is The Barrow Hill?

The Barrow Hill is an original graphic novel following the life of a young girl and the unusual events that surround her.

The story follows the fate of Erika, her fears and dreams, her desire for happiness and her effort to find out more about curious disappearances around her. The more she discovers, the more she feels like the past is just repeating itself.

Join Erika in overcoming the obstacles of life and experience her road to happiness and love.


Who am I?

A freelancing artist as well as a classical archeologist. So far I have been able to (successfully, I believe) combine my love of comics and history both in my own works and in professional cooperation, for example in the form of educational comics.


What is the purpose?

The Barrow Hill has been coming out for two years and so far a half of the story is done. The purpose of this campaign is to collect money which will allow me to finish the story and the art, and publish the work as a book much faster. The final story, which is also being simultaneously released on the web, will be 216 pages long. The book version of the story will include redone page, two new short stories and other bonuses (see rewards).

What do I offer?

An original story of 216 pages, final print including bonus stories, totally comprising 250 pages.

A warm feeling of helping a project that is worth it.

What is needed?

Many things. Firstly, money needs to be collected for the print and distribution of the novel. Some will go towards the drawing and painting, so I can give The Barrow Hill more time. If I don´t need to worry about finances, I will be able to commit myself fully to writing and drawing. At the moment, I am only able to set aside a maximum of two days a week, but more often than not just one.

Complete list of expenses:

-  1300 USD – Fees and taxes (IndieGoGo, PayPal, business tax)

-  2000 USD – Printing expenses

-  1000 USD – Shipping and packaging fees

-  1700 USD – Money for approximately 25 pages of art. These finances will allow me commit at least one more day a week to making the Barrow Hill

Why pay for a webcomic?

Let´s be frank, paper is paper. It can be used for many things besides reading. I can also offer the warm feeling of supporting someone´s dream. For those more materialistic: the paid version will be different from the web version. It will include at least two short comic stories. Some pages will be changed, redone, in short improved.

And who knows, maybe I will be famous one day and my early works will be worth their weight in gold!

Example of changed page (Chapter 01 page 011)


What would I like to do before publishing the comics?

Besides actually finishing the story I would like to improve on a couple of things that would in my opinion improve the reading experience. First and foremost I want to change and partly redo some of the pages that have been already released. I would also like to arrange a professional translation, expand my technical options and as a cherry on top of the cake: publish the entire comic in color! However, many of these aims depend on your help.

List of additional aims:

-  6000 USD – Basic financing

-  6500 USD – Each printed version will include a free poster

-  7500 USD – Additional proofreading

-  9000 USD – Third bonus story

-  11000 USD -  I will have money for Cyntiq and won´t be limited in drawing (i.e. more redone panels and better quality of work)

-  22000 USD – Complete colored version



I would like to support the project but I don´t want to pay

No problem! You can just share this link, vote for the Barrow Hill on Top Web Comics or just write me.

When is it going to be finished?

The expected release date of the complete graphic novel is May 2016. I will be keeping you informed about the progress. Subscribers will also have access to finished pages earlier than the regular readers.

Story so far:

The Barrow Hill webcomics

Do you have any questions? Don´t hesitate to contact us

story:
Project: Hillfall

Project: Hillfall was conceived when one, comic-Manga-Grind House-obsessed, guy thought that those 3 genres could blend together quite nicely. Over the next year, he spent his free time crafting a story with all 3 of those elements.

Project Hillfall follows the life of Colin Zapatero, a 22 year old with great ambition and not much else. Following an explosion, at the town train yard, a fallout of ash causes an outbreak of fantastic abilities in the residents of Hillfall. Tensions rise as local gangs clash with their newly discovered abilities. Colin takes it upon himself to stop the crime that now runs rampant through the city. But, not all is what it seems as locals with "abilities" are going missing among the chaos of clashing gangs.

ABOUT THE TEAM

ALEX MULLER

Alex Muller is the writer and creator of Project: Hillfall. After years of reading comics he decided to bring his stories to the masses. Now that dream is finally being realized with Project: Hillfall.

MATTHEW TIMSON

Matt Timson is a very talented UK illustrator whose credits include:

  • "The Ripper"
  • "The Omnocular Man"
  • "54 Jones"
  • "Labour 7" 
  • "The Last War"
  • "Death Squid"

We are very excited to have Matt on-board. His expertise is invaluable.

MATTHEW TIMSON on PROJECT: HILLFALL

CONCEPT ART

 

Perk Rewards 

ACM Comic Patch

Project: Hillfall Variant Cover

Shear Evil Poster

 

How you can help

If you love what you see here, but can't back the project right now, you can still support Project: Hillfall by getting the word out to friends, family, and other comic lovers. Share through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or any other social media platform. We appreciate any and all support.  We take pride in our comic series.   We hope you'll join us for the ride.

story:
STORY OVERVIEW  

Frankie Bengis is a sassy, bio-engineering prodigy who creates an experimental nanoblood to kill disease and save humans.  She decides to become a guinea pig for the benefit of mankind, but what starts out looking successful turns disastrous for Frankie.  

Carl Galasantos is a religion spouting ex-spy, Frankie's undercover boss at her pharmaceutical company, intent on stealing Frankie's secret nanoblood formula so he can sell it to the highest bidder and disappear into a better life.

OUR TEAM

Corky Arnold creates humorous digital ads using cartoons and graphics for advertising agencies and advertisers.

He's likes horror too. In commercials he's written, produced and directed for Colace, a well-known constipation pill, he created Frankenstein and Vampires as main characters who are constipated and need help.  Even monsters have health issues! 

His first comic book was "Tweeter and the Foofnik," the story of a little girl who can change into a bald eagle and saves supernatural characters like the Foofnik from certain death.

View Corky's work at www.jackhammer.cc 

Ian Miller is an experienced artist, inker and colorist for comics and graphic novels.  His credits include Z-MAN, a horror/zombie comic book series adapted into award-winning animation for Amazon Studios.  Ian's work can be viewed at www.ianjmiller.com 

As a team, Corky and Ian have captured an exciting vision for the Invasion Nano Sapiens graphic novel in style and feeling.

 

 

A HORROR EXPERIENCE YOU'LL NEVER FORGET

Steve Gellman and Corky Arnold are producers and directors for the television screen and movie screen at their company, Jackhammer Entertainment.  From global advertising brands to horror movies released by Lionsgate, their work has touched viewers worldwide.

Whether for clients or backers, their business is producing and delivering complex, high quality creative product – on time, on budget and as promised.

With your support, our novel will be a work of art and a piece of history – one you’ll be proud to own, collect and be part of – and, most  importantly, if you love horror – a fun experience. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP 

$29,863 in contributions will allow us to produce a 50 page version of the story with black and white pages and full-color covers, including writing, design, artwork, printing and shipping.  We are committed to doing everything it takes to deliver a level of excellence worthy of backers' trust. This includes providing timely updates on progress and answers to your questions. 

We hope you will be part of bringing INVASION NANO SAPIENS to life.

What you get

SUMMARY OF AVAILABLE PERKS

DIGITAL COPY of the graphic novel as a high quality pdf

SIGNED PHYSICAL COPY of the graphic novel with laminated soft covers and be printed on glossy coated art stock with section-sewn binding

SIGNED POSTER of the Invasion Nano Sapiens book cover printed in full color on 11" x 17" glossy art stock with a machine varnish finish. 

SIGNED ORIGINAL SKETCHES of the main characters in action

YOU DRAWN IN as a background character (and "monster fodder") (10 available)                      You will be contacted about providing photo(s) to base your character on.

YOU DRAWN IN as a supporting character (2 available)                                                                           You will be contacted about providing photo(s) to base your character on.

YOU DRAWN IN as one of the main characters (3 available)                                                                  You will be contacted about providing photo(s) to base your character on.

 

Stretch Goals

At $42,000 – Full color (LOCKED)

At $53.000 – 10 additional pages added to graphic novel (LOCKED)

At $64,0.00 – 10 more pages added to graphic novel (LOCKED)

Additional stretch goals to be announced.

 

Contact Corky or Steve to talk or find out more --

corky@jackhammer.cc 

steve@jackhammer.cc

Our website is:  www.jackhammer.cc

story:
Team-D is an adventure comic book following the adventures of Dee, a super-smart, young girl, and her grumpy, old teddy bear named Duo, and their little big adventure across the multi-dimensions of the Teddy Bear Universe to save dreams from the Monsters under the bed.

Our story begins as Dee dreams of riding a dinosaur and chasing monsters under the bed, while her grumpy, old teddy bear, Duo, holds on tight to her, only to wake to see her teddy bear jump through a portal, and pausing only to grab her backpack, she follows... Stumbling into an adventure that will take these heroes across the dimensions to save our dreams from the Monsters under the Bed, and their leader, the nefarious Boogeyman.

Our Heroes

Meet our heroes - Dee, our super-smart, young girl and her grumpy, old teddy bear, Duo.

About The Team-D Project:

Team-D is a comic book project that has been bubbling along in the background of the Teddy Bear Tales universe for a long time. Our hero, Dee, is based on my neighbor's super-smart kids, who it has been my honor and privilege to watch grow into amazing, young ladies. Duo, well, he is what I imagine what all old teddy bears become... A little thread worn and grumpy. 

One thing is for sure, these two characters are going to completely shake up the Teddy Bear Tales universe and I hope you all help me start the ride.

This Indiegogo comic book project covers the production of the first run of this story as a comic book, and as backers you will be the first to own and read Team-D!

  • 22 pages of full color action
  • Drawn by Ace Artist Veronica Smith
  • Written by Nick Davis 
  • American comic book format

The Cuddly Toy Perk:

Our Indiegogo features a custom teddy bear build of Duo, Dee's grumpy old teddy bear. This perk is unique to the Team-D campaign and would make an awesome addition and reading companion to the comic book.

Each Duo Teddy Bear is handmade to order by custom teddy bear artist, Dot of Dot's Bears. Each one is unique, with hypo-allergenic soft stuffing, safety clasp eyes/nose and hard wearing five points of articulation, for you to enact all your action poses, and of course to keep you and your loved ones safe at night from the monsters under the bed.

Meet The Team:

This comic book project is a lean labor of love. Here is the talent rundown:

  • Nick Davis -  Writer and creator of Team-D and the Teddy Bear Tales universe it is set in. Also serves as production editor, letterer, tea and coffee boy, dogsbody, and Englishman.
  • Kat Roets - Wordy (The editor who will get all our words right.)
  • Veronica Smith -  The book artist of this story and the primary Team-D artist. See her work in Mr.Button, Spooky Abigail, and the Awakenings comic books.

Our Indiegogo Promise:

'This is not a padded Indiegogo project. Every cent... Every cent!!! goes to the production and printing of this comic book.'

All funding for this project will go to the art, production, and printing of this book. The Indiegogo funding goes to paying the artist and editor, printing of this comic book, and any stretch goals. Production work, layout, lettering, and formatting will be handled at no cost by Project Runner Nick Davis.

Sample Pages:

The words of the book's writer, Nick Davis, turned into English by editor Kat Roets, are brought to life by the artistic talents of Veronica Smith (Awakenings, The Long Tall Tail & Mr Button) as Team-D uncovers a world of wonder and adventure with dark dangers lurking in the shadows. Enjoy the pages below drawn by Veronica Smith: 

Stretch Goals:

Our Project Goal is set to cover the costs of producing this comic book. Anything we do past this will be a bonus and we will be ready to rock those stretch goals as we hit them. 

  • $1050 - All physical reward backers get a poster of the cover - Locked
  • $2000 - Tales From The Teddyverse - anthology comic book - Locked
  • $3000 - Locked

Thank you!

To learn more about the Teddy Bear Tales Universe visit theteddyverse.com

I hope you pledge to help this unique project happen. If you cannot, please share this project with your friends and family using the hashtag #TeamD

story:
“Monster girls on tour” is a webcomic about the journeys and adventures of different monster girls. The protagonist, K’sara, is a salamander warrior who wants to face the strongest people in the fantasy land of Robukan, and in particular, her winged companion, Europa (whom she probably also wants to fuck). The comic has a wide cast of monster girls like lamias, centaurs, harpies, succubus, kitsunes, ants, lizards, dragons, Anubis, moths, onis, and a long etc, including some spanish creatures, and it’s full of absurd humor, geek references, ecchi, manga battles and a lot of trope breaking jokes. If you have a favourite monster, it's either in the comic, or it will be.

  I’ve been doing stories about Robukan for about 8 years, so you’ll find a story with a lot of setting and world building behind. “Monster girls on tour” is my second long comic on this setting, and has been running for more than 2 years already, with a physical version in Spanish (Yes i'm spanish, i make comics in between my bullfighting job and cooking tortilas). If you’re interested in reading the online material, or my other comic Guild adventure (they’re not continuation of each other and can be read independently), you can do it in my website. But if you want to find additional material and exclusive content, you may consider making a pledge for this physical version in English language.

 

What will you find in the physical version? (a.k.a. why the hell should i buy a physical version when the comic is online?). Well first of all is nice to have the comic on paper and support one of the few monster girl comic artists in the west, right? RIGHT?

But also, the physical version will include some exclusive stuff. With the comic you'll get:

-A total of 200 pages, containing chapters prologue, 1, 2, interlude and 3 from the online comic.

 -18 extra pages with situations that happened during the Monster festival of the comic. These pages can usually only be read either buying the special pdf adventure “The festival” in my website, or in the physical comic.  

-3 extra pages for the physical version only  

-Several illustrations, including some nude.  

-Chibi “monster shaming” images

 

What are the extras I can pledge to?  

You can take the chance and ask for an original paper chibi drawing. This is a one in a lifetime chance because since I live in Spain, you’ll not see me at other countries conventions to ask for a drawing, so you can use the excuse of the comic shipping to have one. If you don’t take this chance you’ll regret it for the rest of your life. You, and your children, and your children’s children. For 3 months.  

Here’s an image of what more or less you can expect, although it will obviously be done with physical inks. You can ask me for any character of any of my comics, including Monster girls on tour, Guild adventure, GG Triggerhappy, My little Eve, Team talon blasts off again, and Silica. You can send me a note or message when paying, but I’ll contact you anyways when the crowdfunding ends.

 You can also take the chance to pledge for one of my keychains with my drawings. I only have 10 of each design (except Astolfo, i knew that bastard would sell a lot) so i'll have to limit that pledge to 10 to avoid the chance that everyone ask for the same keychain and i run out of it. Same as before, you can send a note, or i'll contact you afterwards.

How will the money be used?  

The 700$ goal is the minimum quantity I have calculated to print 100 copies (around 340$), get them sent to my house, since I don’t live near any place that would print comics (around 60$), buy 100 book boxes to safely send the comic (around 85$) and still have at least a minimal benefit after indiegogo takes its part. If more than a 100 people pledge (haha, yeah, right), I’ll use that money to make a bigger printing and hope I don’t lose money in the process. 

The end product will be like this, the spanish version, but obviously, in english.

What is the meaning of life?

I don't know man. It probably involves buying Monster girls on tour. Monster girls need love.

story:
Overview

Donald Wright is The Sire, a superhero forced by his own costume to fight evil.

When the world is thrust into chaos by an alien energy transforming normal people into crazed superhumans, The Sire has no choice but to save the day. Which makes having things like a social life or a day-job practically impossible.

Donald Wright is The Sire ... and he really, really doesn’t want to be.

On Thursday October 17th, The Sire was featured on episode four of the hit CBS Show 'EVIL'. It featured a pin up from our most recent trade, 'Sire Volume 2: Lost in Time' by Andrew Mangum and Gene Jiminez. I've gotta tell you it was one of the coolest things to see my work featured on TV even if it was just in the background.

So to celebrate, I thought, why not create a new campaign featuring Andrew and Gene's work as a VARIANT cover to the original Trade it was featured in. It would also be a great way to introduce The Sire to the Indiegogo Community, something I've been wanting to do for a long time now.

So if you like 90's superhero action about a guy who has no control over being a superhero and praise from Newsarama, Comic Buyers Guide and more then you've come to the right place.

Featuring artwork by Talent Caldwell, Jim Calafiore, Dan Leister, Dave Johnson, Tony Moy and more, this campaign is a great way to get on the Sire train before we launch Season 2 #1 in 2020.

Rewards

We're looking for just $500 to bring the Sire Volume 2 Trade EVIL Variant Edition to life. The funds will go to cover print and shipping costs and we need YOUR help.
 
As incentives to get this across the finish line, we've got prints, sketches and of course the entire run of The Sire and  Sire Studios comics, including The Sire, Mainstream, Descendant and more as rewards.
 

Risks & Challenges

The book is DONE! So all we need to do is raise the $500 to cover printing and shipping and we're off and RUNNING!

Other Ways You Can Help

Any questions or concerns please contact us at sirestudiosinc.com.

Please note that when the campaign is closed, all sales are final so we can produce these high quality books and get them out to you as soon as possible. We value your patronage and endeavor to give you a top quality graphic novel. Thank you.

story:
Mizuki Saga portrays the everyday life of Mizuki Wakahisa and friends in a cute comical way.  Mizuki is a energetic girl who has an overactive imagination who tends to blur the lines between fiction and reality as she tends to mimic scenes from games and anime. She usually tends to spend time with Reiko who she make her cosplay and use her as a doll due to her height.

 

$1000= Season 1 Funded.

$1750= Season 2 Green Lit.

$2500=Season 3 Green Lit.

$4500=Reiko Scale Figure Prototype.

$6000= Book 2 in production.

$7500= New Pilot/One Shot chapter added to the book.

$10000= Chibi Figure Prototype + Bonus Reward for all backers.

 

Artist-Sentzukabe

I'm spanish, from the Basque Country state, I've worked as professional since 2016, Arts and Professional Comic and Illustration graduate, Ive done several collaborative books from the galician market as well as for the newspaper as comic strip artist and now Im doing my first solo manga aside my works for clients as manga artist and game graphics.

Scenario-Studio Mizuki

We’re an independent group that’s apart of Magi Entertainment that works on the Megami Saga series and assist with other tasks within the group.

Why Back Mizuki Saga

 

  • We’ll use the funds for the campaign to fund the cost of the book production and cost to make the content for the series.
  • We’ll update free pages to the public weekly via our main website and other respective sites.
  • Several exclusive pages will be bundled with Megami Saga: Resurrection and will include new and extended stories.
  • Our goal is to release the physical releases quarterly when we get enough support.
  • We’ll need your support to help this series off the ground.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are able to contribute to our campaign, that is wonderful!  If you are not able to contribute by becoming a backer, you can still help spread the word.  Please use the share links at the top of the page to help get the word out to others who may be interested in backing the campaign.

I'm spanish, from the Basque Country state, I've worked as professional since 2016, Arts and Professional Comic and Illustration graduate, Ive done several collaborative books from the galician market as well as for the newspaper as comic strip artist and now Im doing my first solo manga aside my works for clients as manga artist and game graphics.
Scenario-Studio Mizuki
We’re an independent group that’s apart of Magi Entertainment that works on the Megami Saga series and assist with other tasks within the group.
Why Back Mizuki Saga
 

We’ll use the funds for the campaign to fund the cost of the book production and cost to make the content for the series.
We’ll update free pages to the public weekly via our main website and other respective sites.
Several exclusive pages will be bundled with Megami Saga: Resurrection and will include new and extended stories.
Our goal is to release the physical releases quarterly when we get enough support.
We’ll need your support to help this series off the ground.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are able to contribute to our campaign, that is wonderful!  If you are not able to contribute by becoming a backer, you can still help spread the word.  Please use the share links at the top of the page to help get the word out to others who may be interested in backing the campaign.

story:
The Story

The infamous late night meal has been compromised. And now POTUS is turning into a ravenous zombie with a never ending craving for junk food! Can even the biggest wall keep Zombie Trump from your double cheeseburger with fries! Pledge and find out!

Why crowd funding?

In the current comic book industry environment we feel this is the best way to get the book into the readers hands. No middle man, you want it you get it directly from us the publisher!

  • The book will be published in black and white...unless, and this is where you come in, we raise $3,000 at that point we will have enough to pay a colorist and cover the extra printing costs. 
  • We are keeping it simple. 2 covers homaging Spiderman #300 by the "Homage King" himself Marat Mychaels. Each color variant cover will have a different ending. 
  • If we don't reach our goal we will use the funds we raise for printing and shipping the book.

Risks & Challenges

The book is drawn...being lettered and if we hit our goal it will be colored. There is no risk, you will receive your book mere weeks after the campaign is completed

Share!

  • If you are a fan of Counterpoint Comics 
  • Please share this campaign on social media. The more we raise the more stretch goals will be unlocked...more swag for you!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Get the word out.
