The packages are mostly shipped, but a lot of people missed out and wanted a digital version, so we've decided to launch it. The book will be sent to you via Indiegogo direct message with a dropbox link.

story:
Good evening.

Tonight we have four chilling tales to terrify you.

There'll be ghosts, the unknown, and perhaps a happy ending. But one thing's for certain...

...we are bound to lose a few heads.

Secret Comics Presents is a comic book packed with unsettling stories penned by writer Nasser Rabadi, drawn by Spawn artist Jason Robinson. This 22 page collection contains four stories: Charlie Finds a Friend, There's Nothing to Be Scared Of, Don't Open the Box, and A Knife in Darkness. This comic will terrify even the most seasoned horror fans.

 

 

 

 

 

In Charlie Finds a Friend, a lonely boy becomes friends with a voice in his radio and uncovers an old secret.

In There's Nothing to Be Scared Of, Vicky confronts her biggest fears--but they just might get her first.

In Don't Open the Box, a man is gifted a small wooden box by his wife, and is instructed not to open it. But when odd things keep occurring, the urge to open it grows stronger.

And in A Knife in Darkness, sometimes horror stories do have happy endings.

If this funds well we have the potential to make this an ongoing book.

Every tier except the digital tier come with a trading card.

With your help, Nasser Rabadi, Shawn Langley, and Joey Turnage were able to produce the HIT indiegogo comics STARDUST and TRIXIE CAIN: BLOOD REAPER, and Nasser and Vic King were able to produce the comic book ASYL. Now, Nasser and artist/collaborator Jason Robinson are ready to launch SECRET COMICS PRESENTS, a horror anthology with the potential to expand into a series IF we have your support.

Our initial goal is to cover production costs of paying Jason for his time, printing the book, having it shipped to me, then shipping it to our wonderful backers. We each have a track record of completing projects, so we WILL deliver the book on time. IF anything does arise that delays the shipping of the book, we will be transparent the entire time with weekly updates on progress.

We pride ourselves in acting professionally and delivering, so you can rest assured that you'll get what you pay for.

If at any time you have a question about the project, my email is NasserRabadi13@yahoo.com, and my Twitter DMs are always open, @NasserRabadi13

We have 9 pages and 2 covers drawn, and Jason is livestreaming the creation of future pages several times a week.

STRETCH GOALS!

$10,000: The book is extended an extra 4 pages of behind the scenes extras.

$15,000: Jason will paint the cover.

$20,000: Every backer gets a SECRET COMICS patch.

$30,000: Work on issue 2 begins.

If you'd like to support us outside of the campaign, you can support Nasser here:

Books: https://www.amazon.com/Nasser-Rabadi/e/B082S3BYWF

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/NasserRabadi

Twitter: https://twitter.com/nasserrabadi13

Newsletter: https://mailchi.mp/3b31e29016d9/nasser

Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/NasserRabadi13

And Jason here:

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/IllustrationByDesign

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/IllustrationByDesign/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/illustration_by_design/

Personal website: www.illustration-by-design.com

PREVIOUS WORKS/ABOUT THE CREATORS

Jason Robinson has been an illustrator since the 1990s, working on a Spawn comic for Todd McFarlane, and working on covers and designs for several other companies. Jason does graphic design, comic art, cover art, and advertisement art. For commissions and potential projects, he can be reached through the links above or by clicking here.

Nasser Rabadi is an author who has self published three comic books, four novels, 5 novellas, and a short story collection. He primarily writes horror/mystery/suspense.

story:
ANGEL'S AWAKENING
A 32 PAGE GRAPHIC NOVEL PLUS ADDITIONAL CONTENT!

FULL COLOR AND ACTION PACKED!

Story

One hundred years in the future, Jessica Sawyer is a spy with the psychic ability of teleportation.  On her first mission, she is sent deep into enemy territory to recover a body in cryogenic stasis which is vital to the security of her homeland.  Jessica must call on all her training and abilities to complete her mission as a powerful water elemental stands in her way.

Written and Created by Daniel Parker

Drawn and Colored by Bogdan Ristea

Lettered By Eric Weathers

Editing by Danni Lynn McDonald 

Variant Cover by Carla Tornielli

Logo Designs by Nodsaibot

THE BOOK IS 100% COMPLETE.  THAT INCLUDES THE ARTWORK AND THE LETTERING!

Any Funding from the Campaign will go straight to publishing the book, production of the perks, shipping costs, and the next book in the series!

Bonus Content

Included with the ANGEL'S AWAKENING story is essentially a Mini-Artbook.  This will include an in-depth look at the Lore of The ANGEL'S AWAKENING Universe from the rise of the warring nation-states and races as well as an exclusive peek at Jessica's gadgets.  Illustrations by Bogdan Ristea will be included.
THERE'S MORE: See Concept Art for Characters along with brief Bios and AN EXCLUSIVE LOOK AT A SURPRISE CHARACTER!

Perks

COVERS:

Along with the main cover for ANGEL'S AWAKENING, beautifully drawn by Bogdan Ristea, but an alternate Virgin cover and a variant cover drawn by the talented Carla Tornielli.  Of course, if you are having a hard time choosing a cover, you can always get all three!

PINUP POSTER

This SEXY Pinup poster featuring the beautiful Jessica Sawyer can be all yours.  Drawn by Bogdan Ristea.

ORIGINAL ART

For One Lucky Backer, Get Yourself Drawn In a Traditional Art Piece with Jessica Sawyer done by Bogdan Ristea.
story_txt: ANGEL'S AWAKENINGA 32 PAGE GRAPHIC NOVEL PLUS ADDITIONAL CONTENT!FULL COLOR AND ACTION PACKED!StoryOne hundred years in the future, Jessica Sawyer is a spy with the psychic ability of teleportation.  On her first mission, she is sent deep into enemy territory to recover a body in cryogenic stasis which is vital to the security of her homeland.  Jessica must call on all her training and abilities to complete her mission as a powerful water elemental stands in her way.Written and Created by Daniel ParkerDrawn and Colored by Bogdan RisteaLettered By Eric WeathersEditing by Danni Lynn McDonald Variant Cover by Carla TornielliLogo Designs by NodsaibotTHE BOOK IS 100% COMPLETE.  THAT INCLUDES THE ARTWORK AND THE LETTERING!Any Funding from the Campaign will go straight to publishing the book, production of the perks, shipping costs, and the next book in the series!Bonus ContentIncluded with the ANGEL'S AWAKENING story is essentially a Mini-Artbook.  This will include an in-depth look at the Lore of The ANGEL'S AWAKENING Universe from the rise of the warring nation-states and races as well as an exclusive peek at Jessica's gadgets.  Illustrations by Bogdan Ristea will be included.THERE'S MORE: See Concept Art for Characters along with brief Bios and AN EXCLUSIVE LOOK AT A SURPRISE CHARACTER!PerksCOVERS:Along with the main cover for ANGEL'S AWAKENING, beautifully drawn by Bogdan Ristea, but an alternate Virgin cover and a variant cover drawn by the talented Carla Tornielli.  Of course, if you are having a hard time choosing a cover, you can always get all three!PINUP POSTERThis SEXY Pinup poster featuring the beautiful Jessica Sawyer can be all yours.  Drawn by Bogdan Ristea.ORIGINAL ARTFor One Lucky Backer, Get Yourself Drawn In a Traditional Art Piece with Jessica Sawyer done by Bogdan Ristea.

story:
*NOTE: As of end of day November 29, 2019, "Thank You in Book" perk will no longer be available. In Demand will be shutting down the following week, but you can visit professordariobava.com for all your PDB needs, pre-orders, and groovy swag! Thank you all for your support!
 

 

Rome, 1967: a Vatican exorcist turns on, tunes in, and drops out to fight monsters with Future Chick, time traveling super-hippie from a heavy tomorrow, and Major Bitch, far out freedom fighting yeti-slayer. Murder Vibes From The Monster Dimension delivers 100 throbbing pages of psychedelic horror carved from the sexy imagination of Phil Mucci, conjured by the black arts of Mike Dubisch!

The first Professor Dario Bava graphic novel, Murder Vibes From The Monster Dimension contains three complete tales: "Blood Puppets of the Fiendish Manitou", in which Father Bava conducts his last and deadliest exorcism for the Vatican, "The Future Blows, Dude!" in which Future Chick discovers her powers in a world of ravenous horrors, and "The Bastard Birthright of Major Bitch" in which an American army brat runs away in post-war Europe to fight for justice against men and monsters. All three characters join forces in the thrilling climax to battle a vampire warlock coven in the Paris catacombs! Righteous!

Not only can you pre-order the book (shipping in February), but we’ve put together some truly awesome perks (shipping beginning in July), including stickers, numbered enamel pins, and limited edition prints, with more exclusive items and artwork to be revealed later!

SIGNED LIMITED EDITION TAGLIETTI PRINTS

Archival giclée prints on 100% cotton hot press 305gsm paper, 18" x 24" (image size), signed and numbered by Emanuele Taglietti himself! We printed an edition of 20 and gave Emanuele #1, so there are only 19 more up for grabs!

VINYL STICKER AND VARIANT POSTER

Our first sticker is a 3" x 3" weather-proof vinyl sticker design selected by our fans, but there's already another design in the works! We're also offering an 11" x 17 " poster version of the Taglietti variant cover to make sure everyone can have it hanging on their wall. Other collectibles and original artwork will be revealed during the campaign and made available to our contributors before anyone else, so join our Inner Sanctum!

NUMBERED ENAMEL PIN

A true collector's item for the Professor Dario Bava completist, these 1.5" two post enamel pins come individually numbered - no two are alike! The backing card features artwork by Emanuele Taglietti and Mike Dubisch, and a description of the symbol's occult origins!

HYPNO-STICKER

The cosmic power of prismatic energy captured in a shimmering slab of mesmerism! Made of pure hypnoleum (the rarest element in the universe), these jumbo stickers stand over five inches tall, converting raw light into mind numbing colors to bewilder and astound!

BUT THAT'S NOT ALL!

This campaign is about much more than money. You’ll get to see the art as it goes from pencils, to inks, to final color and layout. If there's any part of the process you're curious about that we don't cover, just ask in the comments! 

Even if you can't contribute to the campaign, you can still help us out by sharing with your monster loving friends. Use the social media sharing buttons and be a harbinger of horror!

We're scheduled to receive the remainder of our final inks by the end of September, with delivery to the printer scheduled for December. The finished books will ship in June 2019, but all other perks will ship in July 2018, if not sooner.

This is the fourth book we've designed and printed independently, so we're confidant we can meet our deadlines, but unforeseen problems can arise during production. June 2019 delivery is an estimate, but if anything delays it, you'll be the first to know! 

 

Phil Mucci - Creator, Writer, Lettering, Color

An award-winning photographer and filmmaker, Phil has self-published 3 other books covering the process behind the scenes of his first two short films and photography work. On the urging of Diabolik LLC, the production company created by Ian Mackay, Phil began developing the far out world of Professor Dario Bava (PDB) in 2015. With the support of producer Dan Simpson, PDB has expanded from a series of interrelated stories, into scripts for films, graphic novels, and more.

Dan Simpson - Producer, Temporal Weirdener

The newest official member of Diabolik, PDB is Dan's baby! Dan suggested Phil start developing a project that spoke to their mutual love of B-movie monsters and sexy European horror and sci-fi films from the 60's and 70's. Dan embraced PDB wholeheartedly, reaching out to Italian funkmeisters Calibro 35 to compose the theme song, and pairing the Murder Vibes graphic novel script with the incredible art of Mike Dubisch and Emanuele Taglietti.

Ian Mackay - Professor Dario Bava

The founder of Diabolik, and the source of Professor Dario Bava! Ian has appeared in almost every project Phil has shot as a filmmaker, both in front of the camera and behind the scenes as a stop-motion animator and executive producer. He first played Professor Dario Bava in the short film / music video for Huntress "Sorrow", where he kept the entire crew laughing through brutal night shoots by improvising in character between takes. We knew then that the Professor's adventures had to continue!

Mike Dubisch - Illustrator, Main Cover Artist

The visual wellspring of Murder Vibes, internationally known fantasy illustrator and graphic novelist Mike Dubisch has his roots in golden age horror comics and pulp science fiction. A student of the legendary cartoonists Will Eisner and Walter Simonson, Mike has worked for DC, MARVEL, Image and Dark Horse comics. Considered “one of the grand old men of horror comics” by comic art historian Stephen R. Bissette, Mike's art and stories have been featured in horror comic anthologies since his teens, currently appearing in internationally distributed “The Creeps” magazine with the finest artists working in the genre. 

Emanuele Taglietti - Living Legend, Variant Cover Artist

The godfather of Italian comic books, since the early 70's Emanuele Taglietti's work has adorned the covers of erotic, crime, fantasy, and horror fumetti (Italian comic books). Inspired by the work of Frank Frazetta and Averado Ciriello, he created striking art for Zora the Vampire, Belzeba, Cimiteria, Sukia, Stregoneria (“Witchcraft”), Gli Spettri (“The Spectres”), Il Sanguinari (“The Blood”), Lo Schelectro (“The Skeleton”), Ulula (“Howls”), Vampirissimo and Wallestein. His worldwide reputation continues to grow to this day, culminating in 2015 with the gorgeous Sex and Horror: The Art of Emanuele Taglietti, a book by Mark Alfrey, celebrating Taglietti’s work.

Suspiria (Susana Vilchez) - Guest Artist, "Camila"

Born in Barcelona, multimedia artist Suspiria is inspired by female anatomy, 70’s and 80's horror flicks, dark comics, and the holiest of holies, Halloween! A student of art, fashion, and graphic design in Barcelona and the Canary Islands, she's had many solo and group art shows in Europe, Canada, and the United States. Her spooky handmade Terror Tots, created for cuddling, are all uniquely hand-painted on a variety of supple fabrics. Suspiria currently has a studio in Toronto, where she's a custom tattoo artist while working on multimedia projects and shows.

Jill Janus - Huntress, Heshette

One of Diabolik's longtime collaborators, Jill Janus of Huntress  is as rad as they come! To celebrate Professor Dario Bava's first appearance in "Sorrow", Jill Janus crafted a special witch box just for you! We're also adding 3 Huntress "Sorrow" posters to the package, including a limited edition of the painting of Jill and the Baroness Karnstein that appeared in the video! Check out the update for more details, and see more of Jill's witchy delights at Heshette!

NOTE: Since the launch of this campaign, Jill has sadly passed away. In honor of her memory, creativity, and support, we'll be dedicating the graphic novel to her. Rest in Power, Mighty Jill!

Rob Israel - Guest Artist, "Professor Dario Bava vs. The Thing"

Dallas based illustrator/designer Rob Israel spent 13 years in the licensed apparel business before branching out on his own. He's designed t-shirts and posters for established musical acts from the world of edm, punk, and metal. His style ranges from low-brow, psychedelic work to more traditional comic art. He's inspired by everything - from pop culture, to comics, horror art, and politics, and has built a strong social media following where he features new work every day. 

Nick "The Hat" Gucker - Guest Artist, "Dario Bava vs. Legions"

We're proud to announce our third collaboration with Nick The Hat! Diabolik fans might remember Nick's work from Das Muerte "All Those Delicate Cuts", and Monster Magnet "The Duke", but he's most well known for his creepy, psychedelic posters, book covers, and HP Lovecraft illustrations. Winner of the Pickman’s Apprentice Iron Artist challenge, Nick had the honor of creating artwork for the 2013 HP Lovecraft Film Festival posters and merchandise. His work has appeared in group shows from Alaska to Rhode Island, and his first solo show, “A Compendium of Curious Creeps” ran for two months in 2014 at Spectrum House in Seattle. 

Carolina Rodriguez Fuenmayor - Guest Artist, "Miranda"

Based in Bogotá, Colombia, Carolina's unique visual style combines line drawing illustration with digital art and graphic design. "I would like my work to be able to show universes in which the human figure, galaxies, and nature become one... subverting everyday life and boredom, providing them with fantasy, surrealism, and science fiction." We first discovered her work on Brut Magazine's Instagram feed, and we were thrilled when she agreed to do her own interpretation of the graphic novel's villainess, Miranda Korday.

Method Print Co - Custom Screen Printing

Our local print shop, Method, does excellent work!  They made our cast & crew shirts, and the new Paxagram shirt! Method Print Co. specializes in high quality screen printing for local and national brands and small businesses. Their reputation for excellent customer service within the custom apparel industry comes from an emphasis on competitive pricing and quick turnaround; and with a low minimum requirement, there's almost no budget they can't meet!

story:
What happens when you can't wake up from your nightmares?

ASYL is a twenty page horror comic written by Nasser Rabadi (Stardust, Trixie Cain: Blood Reaper, Secret Comics Presents), drawn by Vic King, and lettered by Matt Vealey (Otis Stein). Billy Bacsko is our assistant cleanup artist.

Lena is hunted by Dracula in an insane asylum. Based on the lost film DRACULA'S DEATH, Asyl is inspired by lost films and silent films, especially THE CABINET OF DR. CALIGARI. The story and art are heavily influenced by German expressionism from the 1910s and 1920s.

Every tier except the digital tier comes with a trading card, a patch, and a sticker!

For $10 you get a signed copy of ASYL, an awesome trading card by Jim O'Riley, a Secret Comics patch, and a sticker!

 

Cover and pages 1-6:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Jim O'Riley trading card:        

Patch:

With your help, Nasser Rabadi, Shawn Langley, and Joey Turnage were able to produce the HIT Indiegogo comics STARDUST and TRIXIE CAIN: BLOOD REAPER. Now, Nasser and artist/collaborator Vic King are ready to launch ASYL, a comic with the potential to spawn more horror comics IF we have your support.

We have 5 out of 20 pages done so far. Our initial goal is to cover the costs of printing and shipping the book. We each have a track record of completing projects, so we WILL deliver this book on time.

We pride ourselves in acting professionally and delivering, so you can rest assured that you'll get what you pay for.

If at any time you have a question about the project, my email is NasserRabadi13@yahoo.com, and my Twitter DMs are always open, @NasserRabadi13

 

STRETCH GOALS

$10,000: The cover will be colored, and the colorist will be chosen via our coloring contest.

$15,000: Fan art gallery added to the book.

$30k: All backers get a PDF of Asyl #2 once it's completed (which will be sometime after book 1 is fulfilled)

 

If you'd like to support us outside of the campaign, you can support Nasser here:

Buy Nasser's novels here: https://www.amazon.com/Nasser-Rabadi/e/B082S3BYWF

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuSaSkq8R3_0o3...

Twitter: https://twitter.com/nasserrabadi13

Newsletter: https://mailchi.mp/3b31e29016d9/nasser

Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/NasserRabadi13

 

And Vic here:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/VicKingArt

Ko-Fi: https://ko-fi.com/vickingart

 

PREVIOUS WORKS/ABOUT THE CREATORS

Nasser Rabadi is an author who has self published two comic books, four novels, and a short story collection. He primarily writes horror/mystery/suspense.

Vic King is an artist who has done variant covers for many indie comic book crowdfunds. He is writing and drawing his next comic, DROHNEN, coming to Indiegogo in 2021.

Billy Bacsko (assistant clean up artist) comes from the video game industry where he has worked with companies like SEGA and ODDWORLD Inhabitants. He went on to tour the US with STS9 as a onstage performance painter. Currently Working as a Concept Artist and Illustrator.

Billy on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ghostmonsterz/

Billy on Twitter: https://twitter.com/ghostmonst3r

Billy's ArtStation: https://ghostmonster.artstation.com/

Matthew Vealey is a comic book writer and letter who recently funded his book Otis Stein and is currently working on issue two.

Matthew on Twitter: https://twitter.com/MatthewVealey

story:
This story is set in the kingdom of Bichon and follows the adventures of Nini, a young Ninja and her trusty, but hungry companion Loyal Leo.  Nini has to find and track down the dastardly devil who stole the Bichon Crown.  

The world in which this story is set revolves around dogs, in-fact their whole culture is about dogs.  I mean who doesn’t love dogs right? Well, cat people I suppose, but anyway....

This comic was originally written by a loving father (me) for his daughter, and only after I wrote it did I think that’s pretty good lets make it into a comic for everyone.

So I’m sure you’re wondering about the name?

Well let me enlighten you.   Nin Nin is the classic Japanese sound that ninjas make when doing Ninpo, thats ninja magic to you and me.  

Nini is my nickname for my daughter, Nina.  Its pronounced using the Japanese syllable ‘Ni’, this is like saying the word knee in English.  So the English pronunciation is like saying ‘knee knee’.

About me

Who is Daddy Duder? Well I’m a happily married father of 2 beautiful daughters who lives in Tokyo, Japan.

In case your wondering, yeah I do have a comic planned for my other daughter, but lets cross this bridge first.

The perks dude, lets talk about the perks.

Where to begin? 

Lets start by getting darned right devious and learn about the perk, ‘Join the Doggyquisition!’.

With this perk you can miraculously transform into a dastardly member of the Doggyquisiton.  

The what?

The Doggyquisition! A fanatical group hell bent on enforcing the law regarding the ownership of pedigree dogs.  They will stoop to any means to do this, including torture and murder.  This is a drawn in perk, in which you will get your name and likeness drawn as a character in Issue 2 of the comic, as well as getting a print copy of book 1, and book 2 when its finished.

Check out the page below, with spaces where you will get your lovely mug immortalized in print.

 

We also have the Super Fan perk, this will include a standard and variant print copy, a trading card and a super limited Nin-Nin Nini T-shirt.  This perk will be limited to 5, so you better back it before it goes. 
 

Next, we get down to the print perks, first up we have a 1 of a kind SUPER SUPER rare limited edition variant cover, of which I will only ever sell one copy, and you never know it might be worth something in the future as its a one of a kind print of issue no.1, but don’t take my word for it.  

Also we have a variant cover, and only 19 copies will be sold.  So if want a variant cover this could be right up your alley.

For the backers who don’t wanna pay those pesky postage rates we have the digital ninja perk.

Now it’s time to talk seriously, lets talk about money. 

So what do I need? well any money raised will go on 2 things:

The first is printing costs, and the second is social media advertising, and I am hoping to raise a minimum of $500.  As this is my first comic I need to raise more awareness to sell more copies, both for the first issue and future issues.  I’ve already planned the story for the first 12 issues, and I’m hoping that I can build upon my first campaign and over time gain many supporters. 

As my daughter is the inspiration for my comic, I want to write a story that she can proud of, and I hope the reader can feel the love, care and attention that I’ve put into the story.  And besides this world can always do with another fun story to warm people’s hearts, as its way too serious already.

So that’s what you’re gonna get if you back this comic, a fun exciting read for all ages, well I think so anyway and I hope you do too.

OK, so what’s risk in backing my campaign? NO RISK.

The comic is 100% finished and ready to print, as a matter of fact I’ve already done a small print run as a test, and I’m extremely happy with the print quality. I put January 2022 as the due date so as to allow plenty of time for the printers to do their magic and get the book to you, my lovely readers.

I’ve already started work on issue 2 and have completed the script  and the pencils, and the inking is about 30% completed. 

So there you have it Nin-Nin Nini No.1, I look forward to getting this comic printed and out to my backers, and hope that both my family and customers both love my comic.

Bye the way, If you wanna back my campaign but can’t no worries, but If you could spread the word on social media using the wonders of modern technology that’d be great, oh and remember to use the Indiegogo share tool if you back the campaign.

Stretch Goals

Check out the stretch goals for my campaign.

¥55,000 - UNLOCKED- a free Nini trading card (A7 size)

¥70,000 - UNLOCKED a free Loyal Leo trading card (A7 size)

¥100,000 - secret.

Note:  the stretch goals only apply to physical backers.

Check out some completed pages from the comic.

Above is the test print copies I got printed a few months ago.

Here’s a couple of inked pages from book 2

Thank you very much for looking, now go ahead and make my daughter’s day by backing this campaign.
story_txt:

story:
THE CAMPAIGN HAS BEEN EXTENDED BY TWO WEEKS!

Please go to the "Updates" page and read the July 1st entry to read about the extension, the new perks I've added, and the upgrades that I've made to existing perks!

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/oddly-normal...

-Otis

 

****

 

HI! My name is Otis Frampton.

I'm a comic book writer and artist and the creator of ODDLY NORMAL, published by Image Comics.

 

My most most recent work includes illustrating a series of children's books for DC Comics/Capstone Books, and writing & drawing a story for IDW Publishing's all ages comic book series STAR WARS ADVENTURES. I'm also one of the artists on the popular animated web series "How It Should Have Ended."

And I'd love for you to help me make ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 a reality!

 

What is ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4?

ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 is the next book in the ODDLY NORMAL series that is published by Image Comics.

ODDLY NORMAL is an all ages graphic novel series about a 10 year old girl named Oddly Normal. Her mother is a witch from a fantasy land called Fignation and her father is a human from the real world. Her green hair and pointed ears make her the proverbial outsider at her school and her parents just don't understand her daily troubles as an outcast. On her 10th birthday she makes an ill-advised wish over her birthday cake and her parents vanish! Oddly is then taken to Fignation by her Great Aunt, and that's when her real problems begin! It's It’s THE WIZARD OF OZ meets MONSTERS INC meets HARRY POTTER!

Go here to learn more about the series: https://imagecomics.com/comics/series/oddly-normal 

Praise for ODDLY NORMAL...

"Otis is tapping into that classic thing we all loved about stories growing up... imagination. I'm glad Oddly Normal is on the shelves and hope to see more books like this."
                                                         -Skottie Young (The Wizard of Oz, Rocket Raccoon)

"A charming and relatable fish-out-of-water tale."
                                                         -Hope Larson (A Wrinkle In Time, Flight)

"I've watched Otis create Oddly Normal from the very beginning (via online, not in a creepy, peeking in through the windows way) and it's been a pleasure to watch the evolution of something so special. It's fun, charming and worth saving a space on your shelf for it!"
                                                         -Katie Cook (My Little Pony, Gronk)

BOOK 4 begins the next story arc in Oddly's story.

There will be super heroes, giant monsters, and (as usual) middle school angst set in the magical world of Fignation! As with the previous three books, it will be approximately 136 pages long and consist of 5 chapters (chapters 16-20). These chapters are the length of a standard comic book and will eventually be sold as single issues on ComiXology.

If you (or a loved one) are a fan of the ODDLY NORMAL series and want the next book to become a reality, this IndieGoGo campaign is your chance to help me finish the book and get it out there into the world and into your hands!

Are you new to the ODDLY NORMAL series? You're in luck! You can read issue/chapter #1 for FREE on ComiXology!

https://www.comixology.com/Oddly-Normal-1/digit...


What this IndieGoGo campaign WILL be:

My goal with this campaign is to finance time to work on ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 by pre-selling signed copies of my 200 comps, the copies of the finished book that Image Comics gives me with each printing. I usually sell these comp copies at comic conventions and other personal appearances after the book is released. By pre-selling them via this IndieGoGo campaign, I hope to raise a small amount of money that will allow me to take on less freelance work for a few months and focus solely on finishing ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4.

What this IndieGoGo campaign will NOT be:

Unlike most comic book-based IndieGoGo campaigns, I am not a self-publisher and it is not my intention to sell as many books as possible with the goal of raising a large amount of money. ODDLY NORMAL has been and will continue to be published by Image Comics. I am not in the business of printing and publishing books. I love having a publisher and I’m thrilled that Image Comics continues to support the series. For that reason, I am only selling a limited amount of copies of ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 (the aforementioned 200 comp copies) and I will not be offering a digital version of the book as a reward, as all digital sales are done through Image Comics and their partnership with ComiXology. I am only pre-selling my own personal comp copies of ODDLY NORMAL books, as well as prints and drawings. These are the only rewards that I have to offer, and this will determine the limited goal of this campaign. And that goal is all about taking time off from freelance work for a few months to finish ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4.

 

Here is a detailed breakdown of the IndieGoGo Perks Tiers...

Tier 1:

ODDLY NORMAL TIP JAR!

-Help me make ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 a reality and get exclusive updates on the production of the book here on IndieGoGo! So if you’re not interested in pre-ordering the book and you just want to throw a few duckets into my virtual tip jar, this is your chance!

$3.00

****

Tier 2:

-Help me make ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 a reality and get exclusive updates on the production of the book here on IndieGoGo!
-Your name (or the name of another ODDLY NORMAL fan) on a special THANK YOU page in the book!

$10.00

100 AVAILABLE

****

Tier 3:

-ODDLY NORMAL Book 4 (Signed)
-Help me make ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 a reality and get exclusive updates on the production of the book here on IndieGoGo!
-Your name (or the name of another ODDLY NORMAL fan) on a special THANK YOU page in the book!
-Exclusive Print (Signed)

$40.00

100 AVAILABLE

****

Tier 4:

-ODDLY NORMAL Book 4 (Signed)
-Help me make ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 a reality and get exclusive updates on the production of the book here on IndieGoGo!
-Your name (or the name of another ODDLY NORMAL fan) on a special THANK YOU page in the book!
-Exclusive Print (Signed)
-Original drawing of Oddly!

$50.00

65 AVAILABLE

****

Tier 5:

-ODDLY NORMAL Books 1-4 (Signed)
-Help me make ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 a reality and get exclusive updates on the production of the book here on IndieGoGo!
-Your name (or the name of another ODDLY NORMAL fan) on a special THANK YOU page in the new book (BOOK 4)!
-Exclusive Print (Signed)
-Original drawing of Oddly!

$100.00

25 AVAILABLE

****

Tier 6:

-ODDLY NORMAL Books 1-4 (Signed)
-Help me make ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 a reality and get exclusive updates on the production of the book here on IndieGoGo!
-Your name (or the name of another ODDLY NORMAL fan) on a special THANK YOU page in the book!
-Exclusive Print (Signed)
-Original drawing of Oddly!
-A page of original artwork from ODDLY NORMAL Book 4!

$200.00

5 AVAILABLE

****

Tier 7:

ODDLY NORMAL Books 1-4 (Signed)
-Help me make ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 a reality and get exclusive updates on the production of the book here on IndieGoGo!
-Your name (or the name of another ODDLY NORMAL fan) on a special THANK YOU page in the book!
-Exclusive Print (Signed)
-Original drawing of Oddly!
-A page of original artwork from ODDLY NORMAL Book 4!
-The original artwork for the cover of the digital edition of one of the chapters/issues from ODDLY NORMAL Book 4! (The digital editions of each chapter/issue will eventually be sold by Image Comics on the ComiXology digital comics platform. The cover images for these digital versions WILL be included in the back of ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4, just as they were with previous books in the series)

$300.00

5 AVAILABLE

****

 

Once again, my goal is a modest one. I just want to pre-sell enough books to take time off from freelance work to finish ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4. I love Oddly and I love working on this series and I would be ever so grateful to have your help to continue making it a reality.

If you have a question that you need answered about this campaign before contributing, please feel free to ask. I'll answer ASAP and add it to my FAQ for the project.

Thank you for reading and for considering my ODDLY NORMAL BOOK 4 IndieGoGo campaign!

Your pal,

Otis

 

****

Website: http://www.otisframpton.com/

Twitter: @otisframpton

Instagram: @otisframpton

Facebook: https://m.facebook.com/otisframptonart/

How It Should Have Ended: www.youtube.com/HISHEdotcom

story:
THE SKETCHBOOK IS HEADING TO THE PRINTER

We've received the rough of the sketchbook and Steve has approved it!  The digital version is available once funds clear around July 19th.  Books expected to ship early August!  Steve gives a sneak peek of both the 2021 sketchbook and his new masterpiece: Nexus: The Coming of Gourmando, also shipping in August.

HISTORY OF STEVE RUDE SKETCHBOOKS

Steve Rude started producing sketchbooks in 2003.  Back then everyone was doing cheap Kinko's copies.  Even back then Steve knew that quality came first, and we put together an 8½x11" professionally printed black and white book.  That book was entirely made up of pages from Steve's private sketchbook that he would show around at comic conventions.  Over the years the book has grown, and is now full color, includes many of the popular comic characters that Steve does during the year, but, true to the beginnings, it contains many pages direct from Steve' private sketchbooks.

2021 SKETCHBOOK

This project was funded on Kickstarter so the book will be happening.   We know that not everyone uses Kickstarter so we are offering a selection of packages including ones with original art!

ORIGINAL ARTWORK

EXAMPLES OF 2020 SKETCHBOOK COVERS - THE BELOW ARE NOT FOR SALE.

PRESALE EXCLUSIVE

All presale books will come with immediate access (upon funding) to the digital flipbook version of the sketchbook. 

NEXUS: THE COMING OF GOURMANDO

Due to COVID 19 shipping delays, the Hardcover version of the Gourmando book will not ship until August.  Because this is the same time as our 2021 Sketchbook should be shipped we are offering some packages including the book!  SteveRude.com/Gourmando for details on the book or watch the videos!

UPGRADES / CHECKOKUT

While we do collect most payments and addresses via Indiegogo, we do have a final checkout via BackerKit.  Backerkit is how we finalize and organize the campaign to ensure your order is correct and doesn't get lost or misplaced.

When you checkout via Backerkit, if you ordered an unsigned copy you will have the opportunity to upgrade to a signed copy for only $5.  You may also upgrade the cover from the Wonder Woman cover to the White Queen alternative cover for only $10 (+$15 w/signature).  You will also be able to customize a package ordering extra copies, past books, prints, etc.

CHECK OUT RIGHT AWAY when funds clear around July 19th and you can add a FREE bonus gift via Add-Ons.

FREE SHIPPING ON INTERNATIONAL ORDERS 

If you order $200, contact us and we will arrange free shipping.  See the FAQs for details.

TURN AROUND

This book is already nearing the end of production.  We are expecting the hardcopy proof in house around June 10th and barring tons of changes from Steve we should have final files to the printer by June 14th which puts shipping around the 1st part of August.

No Deadline for the Deals

Because this is a quick turn around project and we plan to use funds to help with shipping costs, the actual campaign will be short, however, we will continue to offer packages via IndieGoGo InDemand until our next Kickstarter is launched in a few months.

Risks & Challenges

We have been self publishing books since 2003 with our first "Steve Rude Sketchbook".  We pride ourselves on quality and communication.  Things don't always go as planned, especially with COVID shipping delays and other factors.  If errors are caught before printing Steve has been known to stop the presses to get it fixed.  Quality over

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share: www.SteveRude.com/gourmando for Steve's latest Nexus project
  • Share: www.SteveRude.com/2021skb for this project!
  • Support us on Patreon: www.Patreon.com/steverude
story_txt:
THE SKETCHBOOK IS HEADING TO THE PRINTER
We've received the rough of the sketchbook and Steve has approved it!  The digital version is available once funds clear around July 19th.  Books expected to ship early August!  Steve gives a sneak peek of both the 2021 sketchbook and his new masterpiece: Nexus: The Coming of Gourmando, also shipping in August.

HISTORY OF STEVE RUDE SKETCHBOOKS
Steve Rude started producing sketchbooks in 2003.  Back then everyone was doing cheap Kinko's copies.  Even back then Steve knew that quality came first, and we put together an 8½x11" professionally printed black and white book.  That book was entirely made up of pages from Steve's private sketchbook that he would show around at comic conventions.  Over the years the book has grown, and is now full color, includes many of the popular comic characters that Steve does during the year, but, true to the beginnings, it contains many pages direct from Steve' private sketchbooks.


2021 SKETCHBOOK
This project was funded on Kickstarter so the book will be happening.   We know that not everyone uses Kickstarter so we are offering a selection of packages including ones with original art!

ORIGINAL ARTWORK


EXAMPLES OF 2020 SKETCHBOOK COVERS - THE BELOW ARE NOT FOR SALE.

PRESALE EXCLUSIVE
All presale books will come with immediate access (upon funding) to the digital flipbook version of the sketchbook. 


NEXUS: THE COMING OF GOURMANDO
Due to COVID 19 shipping delays, the Hardcover version of the Gourmando book will not ship until August.  Because this is the same time as our 2021 Sketchbook should be shipped we are offering some packages including the book!  SteveRude.com/Gourmando for details on the book or watch the videos!
UPGRADES / CHECKOKUT
While we do collect most payments and addresses via Indiegogo, we do have a final checkout via BackerKit.  Backerkit is how we finalize and organize the campaign to ensure your order is correct and doesn't get lost or misplaced.
When you checkout via Backerkit, if you ordered an unsigned copy you will have the opportunity to upgrade to a signed copy for only $5.  You may also upgrade the cover from the Wonder Woman cover to the White Queen alternative cover for only $10 (+$15 w/signature).  You will also be able to customize a package ordering extra copies, past books, prints, etc.
CHECK OUT RIGHT AWAY when funds clear around July 19th and you can add a FREE bonus gift via Add-Ons.
FREE SHIPPING ON INTERNATIONAL ORDERS 
If you order $200, contact us and we will arrange free shipping.  See the FAQs for details.
TURN AROUND
This book is already nearing the end of production.  We are expecting the hardcopy proof in house around June 10th and barring tons of changes from Steve we should have final files to the printer by June 14th which puts shipping around the 1st part of August.
No Deadline for the Deals
Because this is a quick turn around project and we plan to use funds to help with shipping costs, the actual campaign will be short, however, we will continue to offer packages via IndieGoGo InDemand until our next Kickstarter is launched in a few months.

Risks & Challenges
We have been self publishing books since 2003 with our first "Steve Rude Sketchbook".  We pride ourselves on quality and communication.  Things don't always go as planned, especially with COVID shipping delays and other factors.  If errors are caught before printing Steve has been known to stop the presses to get it fixed.  Quality over

Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Share: www.SteveRude.com/gourmando for Steve's latest Nexus project
Share: www.SteveRude.com/2021skb for this project!
Support us on Patreon: www.Patreon.com/steverude

story:
JUST ADDED: SKETCH OPTION

If you've already ordered please email me with your request and I can add it on and send you a checkout link.  If you haven't ordered then 10 days after your InDemand order you will receive a checkout from BackerKit to make all your options.  Adding a sketch to the book will be one of the options.  See UPDATES for the full list of options!

 

To the Exceptional People who continue to support NEXUS

How many of you miss the simple excitement from these bygone years, and wished it would return? As two creators that entered the comic field in 1981, publisher and artist Steve Rude, along with partner and Nexus creator Mike Baron, wanted to move our industry forward by returning to something that made the popularity of comics what it was. It was time for someone to revive the excitement of the Adventure strips, and we’d begin by adapting it to our longtime creation Nexus. 

Five years ago, Rude Dude Productions reintroduced something that the world of publishing had thought virtually extinct; the full-page Sunday newspaper adventure strip.   For a while, I’ve been asking, “What happened to the American comic strip?” Reduced almost microscopically by the 1970’s, I’ve wondered the same. So, with no one limiting us but ourselves, in 2015, we began adapting the award-winning Nexus comic book into a Sunday newspaper strip.  we’re happy to finally announce that the entirety of these Nexus strips will now be published in one massive collection.

Anyone who has ever ordered from us knows we care about the quality.  This is not a "kinkos" handmade book.  All our books (and everything we do) is top quality, professionally printed, thick stock, archival safe, and we spend thousands on sturdy shipping containers, mailers, tubes, and packaging to get those items to you safely.  If something is damaged we will replace it on request.  Back us and support quality and high standards.

Collections offered in 3 Formats:

Limited Edition is signed by Mike Baron and Steve Rude, numbered, and comes with a slipcase and is shrinkwrapped

Certificate included in levels with extras

NOTE: Both the Trade Paperback and the Hardcover Editions had different designers and pages had to be formatted differently so each book is a unique experience.

This book is going to print regardless of funds raised in IndieGoGo.  We already ran this on Kickstarter and it was successful, this is an extremely limited printing so we are offering it here as a last chance to get in on these amazing deals before the book sells out. 

The TPB is at the printer and expected to arrive in May.  The hardcover is being reformatted to the larger size and we expect it to ship in June or July.  If you order the set your order will ship together once the hardcover arrives.

The Impact

This is something more than just an exciting read; it is the return to something that people haven’t seen since the 1950’s. For 60 years, everyone from Wall-Streeters to Dust-Bowlers looked forward to the Sunday comics section, and every newspaper stand in America and around the world carried it.

Far Side creator, Gary Larson, when asked about the enjoyment people got from reading his zany strip, once told us, "Well, it's not like the people who draw comic strips are curing cancer or anything."

For a long time, I thought about what Larson had said. Here’s my conclusion:

While everyone goes through their daily paces, dealing with everything life throws at us, there are still things, often during the briefest passing moments, that might still considered miraculous. Anything that might temporarily lift our spirits, help us forget life’s trials, and give us a chance to dream again.  Along with that might be having something to look forward to.

The weekly comic strip adventures of Nexus is our humble offering to that belief. For those subscribers who wanted to know how the story finally ends, or to the many who have been reading it online at Patreon.com/steverude, these strips are now available.

Into the light and forward to the future,

Steve Rude

Risks & Challenges

We have been self publishing books since 2003 with our first "Steve Rude Sketchbook".  We pride ourselves on quality and communication.  Things don't always go as planned, especially with COVID shipping delays and other factors.  If errors are caught before printing Steve has been known to stop the presses to get it fixed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share: www.SteveRude.com/gourmando
  • Support us on Patreon: www.Patreon.com/steverude

The weekly comic strip adventures of Nexus is our humble offering to that belief. For those subscribers who wanted to know how the story finally ends, or to the many who have been reading it online at Patreon.com/steverude, these strips are now available.
Into the light and forward to the future,
Steve Rude

Risks & Challenges
We have been self publishing books since 2003 with our first "Steve Rude Sketchbook".  We pride ourselves on quality and communication.  Things don't always go as planned, especially with COVID shipping delays and other factors.  If errors are caught before printing Steve has been known to stop the presses to get it fixed.

Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Share: www.SteveRude.com/gourmando

Support us on Patreon: www.Patreon.com/steverude

story:
Cover, pages 1-5:

 

 

 

Sneak peeks at some backup story WIP:

 

Shawn's print for "Massacre at Outpost 37". One of the backups will be based on this.

What is Stardust?

Stardust is a 20-page one shot horror/sci-fi story, with the potential to become 28 pages if we hit our stretch goal.

Stardust is about an alien species who lands here on earth. Most are shot down, but one escapes the gunfire and tries to get even.

Our initial goal is $2,050. That covers paying Shawn for his time drawing the rest of the book (so far, the cover and pages 1-5 are done), as well as paying the letterer, Joey Turnage. The rest of the money goes right to printing and shipping.

 

Why should you back us? And where is the money going?

We each have a track record of completing personal projects. Nasser has self published two novels, so he has taken the time to learn how to properly format files, how to hit deadlines when he's the only one worried about them, and how to finish what he starts.

Shawn has delivered on time for gigs with Marvel comics trading cards, as well as a graphic novel for Source Point Press.

Joey has lettered his own comic, Something Real #1.

We need the money to properly print and ship the books, we also need money to pay Shawn for his time.

We're able to price the book so low because we're planning to ship cost effectively. The book will be printed from ComixWellSpring, and they give a great deal on printing.

Nasser also has a business degree, and is aware of how to run and stay on top of a business, and is now putting that into practice.

We pride ourselves in acting professionally and delivering, so you can rest assured that you'll get what you pay for- and you won't have to wait years without an update.

If at any time you have a question about the project, my email is NasserRabadi13@yahoo.com, and my Twitter DMs are always open, @NasserRabadi13.

Horror is a passion for the three of us. Shawn and I developed a story we were comfortable with and something he'd like to draw. This, if funded, would be my first published comic, so we really wanted to make an impression.

We all want to thank you for taking the time to read about and consider our project.

Risks and challenges

Shawn has to complete the rest of the art, and that is directly where most of this money is going. Of course, art takes time, we get that and have factored it in, but we WILL get this product to you or your money back guaranteed.

I, Nasser Rabadi, am acknowledging that at the time of posting, the book is not completed yet, but you have our word it will be.

Stretch goals!

If we can hit $3,000, then the comic will increase to 28 pages. We will add two additional stories from Nasser and Shawn, as well as a pinup from Shawn.

Please note that the extra 8 pages will add to the time it takes, but we will do everything we can to make this book happen.

If we hit $10,000 then every backer of $25 and up will receive one trading card! Backers of $20 and under have a chance to get a trading card, but no guarantee. We will be hiding very few cards at random in the books for backers of $20 and under.

If we hit $11,000 then every backer $20 and up gets a bookmark, and every backer at EVERY tier gets a pdf of Something Real #1.

Other ways to help:

Word of mouth is the reason most people pick up books. If you think this is something a certain person would like, please tell them about it. If you don't have anyone in mind, then just a share on social media helps too.

story:
Introduction

There are many of writers, artists, and storytellers in the world.  But truthfully, there are not a lot of people that can do it all.  I'm talking about creators that can combine art and words into a cohesive package.  I'm talking about visual storytellers.

Visual Storytellers Comic Showcase Issue #1 highlights a few of the elite visual storytellers Kool, Lue Sang, and Scott.

Brad Scott Studios (BSS) has decided to step into the publishing realm to give independent comic creators opportunities they may not be able to get with the big companies.  There is talent out there that needs to be highlighted and BSS wants to be the place to deliver that talent to you.  So for our inaugural issue, we wanted to showcase a few of the total package creators.

The Artist known as Kool as Heck, Brian Lue Sang, and Brad Scott have created independent comics, beautiful illustrations, stunning stories, and graced the show floor at numerous comic conventions throughout the southeast United States.  Each creator brings a unique style to the Visual Storytellers Comic Showcase to enchant you with 5 short stories (Mature Content): 

Icarus - A school essay reveals a teenager's hopes and goals. (Kool)

Tatter - A down on his luck former hero gets a serious wake up call. (Kool)

Movie Night - Love is in the air when a simple mugging goes wrong. (Scott)

Head Hunters - Man versus beast versus woman in the land of the minotaur. (Scott)

The Deep - Using antiquated equipment, a diver embarks on a journey that turns out to be far more than it initially seems. (Lue Sang)

Each story written and drawn by the creator themselves.  The Comic Showcase is over 50-pages of creator-owned storytelling.

Being and independent artist is hard, but the work is extremely satisfying.  Taking a blank piece of paper from a twinkle of a thought in your mind to a graphic story enjoyed by others is quite a breathtaking accomplishment.

Thank you for considering supporting us on our journey as independent comic creators.  We are so proud to share these 5 short stories as we delve into the fantasy realm.

Standard Comic Cover (Virgin)

 

Standard Comic Cover (b/w)

 

The Creators

Kool as Heck

Kool has been an independent and freelance artist for over 3 decades.  His keystone comics Evenfall and Brisingamen has graced comic store shelves throughout the country.  He creates trading cards for Marvel/Upper Deck/ and Fleer.

Brian Lue Sang

Brian has been a doodler his entire life.  His most popular comics God Lore and Wild World of Ogots are available through multiple venues.  His ink wash skills are incredible.

Brad Scott

Brad is an art practioner in traditional and digital media.  His table top role playing game Lords of the Labyrinth allows him to share his art and storytelling in unique ways.

Our Goals

We are raising money to pay for color printing.  These days it's pretty easy to create a product and distribute it digitally to the masses.  But the truth is, nothing beast holding a physical comic book in your hands.  Kool, Brian, and Brad all create art traditionally and digitally, but original artwork on paper boards is just stunning.   We are also comic lovers and spend untold hours in comic book stores.  Every comic creator dreams of having their work on the shelves of their favorite comic store.

We don't want to make this complicated, we just want to print and sell our comic book.

To say Thank You for supporting our creation, we are offering some great perks including:

  • Multiple Covers
  • Signed and Graded Comic Books
  • Original Sketch Cover Art
  • Comic Shop Bundles
  • Posters and Postcards

The Big Deal

This is the first published comic from Brad Scott Studios.  Success on Issue #1 also means the chance to give a shot to more creators on Issue #2 and beyond.  We want to continually support independent creators and give them a chance to "get on the shelf".

Stretch Goals

Once we reach our initial goal to cover the color printing cost, we will release stretch goals to include Sketch Cover Blanks with original art drawn by your favorite creator, original art pages, digital comic books, plus others.

Challenges

Our biggest challenge is printing the comic book in color.  Before this funding campaign launched we spent several months brainstorming, writing, and drawing.  We wanted to make sure we had a great product to promote.  The stories are complete, the drawings are complete, and we are in the coloring phase.  By the time this campaign is over we should be reviewing the proofs and approving the final comic Book.

If this campaign is not fully funded, comic books will still be shipped out, but they may be with black and white interiors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we completely understand.  But you can still help.

Please follow this campaign, share this campaign with friends and family, and share this campaign on your social media.  Indiegogo has several tools available to help you Share!

story:
Quick Notes

  • We are doing a very small, very limited print run of this amazing book. It will not be offered to comic shops via Diamond Comic Distributers so we strongly suggest that you pre-order via this campaign to guarantee that you will get a book.
  • This is an independently-published book so your support is going directly to the creators—artist P. Craig Russell and publisher Wayne Alan Harold.
  • Page count is expected to be between 144-148 pages (content is subject to change).​
  • ​Perks are available "a la carte"—so feel free to pledge multiple times for multiple items.
  • All items will ship with both tracking and full insurance, so pledge with confidence.
  • To see photos of our previous Fine Art Editions, please visit artofpcraigrussell.com


This beautiful 12"X17" oversized hardcover features complete stories scanned from P. Craig Russell's stunning original art. While appearing to be in black and white, each page has been scanned in color to recreate as closely as possible the experience of viewing the actual originals-including blue pencils, notes, art corrections and more. Pages are reproduced at original size on heavy paper stock to provide fans, aficionados and collectors with the best possible reproductions.

This 148-page Fine Art Edition includes the following complete stories, songs and poems—many of which will be seeing print for the very first time:
 

  • Opus 06 - The Avatar and The Chimera (1978, 16 pages)

  • Opus 21 - Pelléas & Mélisande (1985, 56 pages)

  • Opus 26 - Ariane and Bluebeard (1988, 42 pages)

  • Opus 69 - Two Anxious Songs (Whispers at Night, Beheading) (2013, 2 pages)

  • Opus 70 - Little Nemo in Final Slumberland (2013, 1 page)

  • Opus 71 - Day and Night (Two Songs) (2014, 2 pages)

  • Opus 72 - Two Songs by Hugo Wolf (Spring, Autumn) (2014, 2 pages) 

  • Opus 74 - The Spectre of the Rose (Two Songs) (2015, 2 pages) 

  • Opus 75 - Pendant to the Rose (A Symbolist Fantasy) (2016, 2 pages)

  • BONUS GALLERY: Selected color pages from The Dreaming City (12 pages)


The book also features new cover art and a new illustrated logo by P. Craig Russell!

Available In Four Hardcover Editions:

  • Standard Edition Hardcover
  • Signature Edition Hardcover - Comes personally signed by P. Craig Russell!
  • Sketch Edition Hardcover - Comes personally signed by P. Craig Russell with a PEN AND INK SKETCH by the artist! Art will be on a separate board that's approximately 8" x 10"—keep it in the book or frame it for posterity! (You will get to pick the sketch/pose based on three provided samples—scroll down on this page to see the sample sketches.)
  • Deluxe Sketch Edition Hardcover - Limited to only ten (10) copies, this super-rare edition includes ALL THREE of the original sketches that are being offered! SOLD OUT!

 

Sketch Edition Sketch Samples

Sketches will be in pen and ink on a separate 8" x 10" board. You can keep it in the book or display it separately! Details will vary on the final pieces—Craig likes to make them all a little different so that they are more unique—but you can choose from the following poses for your sketch:

Sketch Choice #1:

Sketch Choice #2:

Sketch Choice #3:

 

 

P. Craig Russell Discusses The Project

"Our new Fine Art Edition is a little unusual this time—it’s not directed at certain characters or collections of short stories—we’re simply going to call it P. Craig Russell's Symbolist Fantasies and Other Things."

"It kicks off with two longer, complete stories—comic-book adaptations of Maurice Maeterlinck’s Ariane & Bluebeard and Pelléas and Mélisande. Today, Maeterlinck is probably most remembered for writing The Blue Bird, a play that was made into a movie at least three times. Ariane & Bluebeard and Pelléas and Mélisande will, like everything in this book, be scanned from the original art. It’s in great shape so it should make for some stunning reproductions. These complimentary stories will be followed by 1978’s The Avatar and The Chimera which hearkens back to the Star*Reach days."

"And then there's my one page Little Nemo story—Little Nemo in Final Slumberland—which I wrote, drew penciled, inked, colored and lettered. I just did everything on the piece! It's had limited distribution before and will fit in very nicely here."

"Most exciting is the all-new material that will be seeing print in the book for the very first time. I’ve been working on these single-page, tabloid-size adaptations of songs or poems. A few of them were published years ago, but others have haven't been seen at all. So that will be all-new material—I think the first time that completely new material will be seen in an “Artists Edition” type of book."

"We’ll also be doing a special Bonus Gallery featuring a dozen of the best pages from The Dreaming City. It was all hand-colored on the original artwork, one of the only two or three times I've done that over the years. And there are no words on it—the original lettering was done on overlays and we’re doing away with that. The original artwork has been in storage for 30 years and it looks like the day that I painted it. So we have all new scans of that. I’m going to go through and select the choicest pieces that relate to the symbolist fantasy theme."

"So many of the themes have to do with dreams—with that whole movement that I'm referring to, the symbolism is about dream worlds. And it comes more from art that's about an inner side rather than outer—the dream world or psychological states. It’s sort of a precursor to expressionism and surrealism as opposed to the school of realist painting or naturalist painting or impressionism."

"We're just going all out with the most obscure—yet I think most visually exciting—things to look at, without any reference to mainstream comics. It’s way deeper into the fantasy genre. A lot of us guys who started working in the seventies—Kaluta, Vess, Wrightson and Windsor-Smith—we were all influenced by that era of late 19th, early 20th century art and book illustration. All of these guys have continued working for decades, but that's where we came from. And so this book hearkens back to that."

 

    The Ariane and Bluebeard Fine Art Print

    In addition to the book itself, we are also offering the Ariane & Bluebeard Giclée Print (pictured above). Image size is approximately 15x15" with an additional white border on all sides. Our fine art Giclées are printed with archival UltraChrome inks on 100% cotton acid-free rag paper. Each and every print comes personally signed by P. Craig Russell.



     

    About The Artist

    A graduate of the University of Cincinnati with a degree in painting, P. Craig Russell has run the gamut in comics. After establishing a name for himself at Marvel on Killraven and Dr. Strange, he went on to become one of the pioneers who opened new vistas for this underestimated field with, among other works, adaptations of operas by Mozart (The Magic Flute), Strauss (Salome) and Wagner (The Ring of the Nibelung). He is also well-known for his acclaimed graphic novel adaptations of Lois Lowry’s The Giver as well as Neil Gaiman’s Coraline, American Gods and the soon-to-be-published Norse Mythology.




     

    Shipping Information

    Orders shipped outside of the United States will almost always be charged customs fees when they arrive. These fees may include taxes, duties, processing fees, brokerage fees, etc. We have no control over the amount or assessment of these fees. We will not mark items as a "gift." If you are not familiar with the customs laws and fees in your country, please check with your local customs office for more information.

    It is possible that the delivery of your order could be delayed due to customs processing. If your order does not arrive in a reasonable amount of time, you should check with your local customs office to see if they are holding the package for payment of fees.

    We know that international shipping has gotten very expensive, but unfortunately that is out of our control. We make no money from the shipping fees and actually end up subsidizing some of the shipping costs due to campaign fees, credit card processing fees, packaging costs, etc.
story_txt:
Quick Notes

We are doing a very small, very limited print run of this amazing book. It will not be offered to comic shops via Diamond Comic Distributers so we strongly suggest that you pre-order via this campaign to guarantee that you will get a book.
This is an independently-published book so your support is going directly to the creators—artist P. Craig Russell and publisher Wayne Alan Harold.

Page count is expected to be between 144-148 pages (content is subject to change).​

​Perks are available "a la carte"—so feel free to pledge multiple times for multiple items.

All items will ship with both tracking and full insurance, so pledge with confidence.

To see photos of our previous Fine Art Editions, please visit artofpcraigrussell.com

This beautiful 12"X17" oversized hardcover features complete stories scanned from P. Craig Russell's stunning original art. While appearing to be in black and white, each page has been scanned in color to recreate as closely as possible the experience of viewing the actual originals-including blue pencils, notes, art corrections and more. Pages are reproduced at original size on heavy paper stock to provide fans, aficionados and collectors with the best possible reproductions.
This 148-page Fine Art Edition includes the following complete stories, songs and poems—many of which will be seeing print for the very first time: 

Opus 06 - The Avatar and The Chimera (1978, 16 pages)
Opus 21 - Pelléas & Mélisande (1985, 56 pages)
Opus 26 - Ariane and Bluebeard (1988, 42 pages)
Opus 69 - Two Anxious Songs (Whispers at Night, Beheading) (2013, 2 pages)
Opus 70 - Little Nemo in Final Slumberland (2013, 1 page)
Opus 71 - Day and Night (Two Songs) (2014, 2 pages)
Opus 72 - Two Songs by Hugo Wolf (Spring, Autumn) (2014, 2 pages) 
Opus 74 - The Spectre of the Rose (Two Songs) (2015, 2 pages) 
Opus 75 - Pendant to the Rose (A Symbolist Fantasy) (2016, 2 pages)
BONUS GALLERY: Selected color pages from The Dreaming City (12 pages)


The book also features new cover art and a new illustrated logo by P. Craig Russell!Available In Four Hardcover Editions:


Standard Edition Hardcover
Signature Edition Hardcover - Comes personally signed by P. Craig Russell!
Sketch Edition Hardcover - Comes personally signed by P. Craig Russell with a PEN AND INK SKETCH by the artist! Art will be on a separate board that's approximately 8" x 10"—keep it in the book or frame it for posterity! (You will get to pick the sketch/pose based on three provided samples—scroll down on this page to see the sample sketches.)
Deluxe Sketch Edition Hardcover - Limited to only ten (10) copies, this super-rare edition includes ALL THREE of the original sketches that are being offered! SOLD OUT!



 
Sketch Edition Sketch Samples
Sketches will be in pen and ink on a separate 8" x 10" board. You can keep it in the book or display it separately! Details will vary on the final pieces—Craig likes to make them all a little different so that they are more unique—but you can choose from the following poses for your sketch:
Sketch Choice #1:

Sketch Choice #2:

Sketch Choice #3:

story:
Ethan Van Sciver trading card that comes with every physical order!

 

SHAWN LANGLEY'S COVER:

 

JON MALIN'S COVER:

 

DINAH ISRAEL'S COVER:

 

ERIC WEATHERS COVER:

 

PAGES TWO, THREE, SIX, AND SEVEN

 

 

 

ONE OF THE POSSIBLE TRADING CARDS (BY @RENDERCONTENDER)

 

STARDUST 2ND PRINT COVER BY BEN JONES!!!

TRIXIE CAIN: BLOOD REAPER is a 60 page horror comic book about a girl who hates her father because his job as a member of the Order of The Blade made life terrible for her family. Does she hate him enough to not rescue him when he's captured by Blood Reapers?

With your help, Shawn, Joey, and I were able to self-publish the HIT summer 2018 comic STARDUST. Now we're ready to launch our next collaboration: Trixie Cain: Blood Reaper. This is the first book in the series which will potentially run anywhere from 3-5 issues IF we have your support.

Along with Trixie Cain, we have a reprint of STARDUST available for purchase, with a new cover by Ben Jones.

Our initial goal is to cover production costs of paying Shawn and Joey for their time, printing the book, having it shipped to me, then shipping it out to our wonderful backers. We each have a track record of completing projects, so we WILL deliver the book on time. IF anything does arise that delays the shipping of the book, we will be transparent the entire time with a weekly update on progress.

We pride ourselves in acting professionally and delivering, so you can rest assured that you'll get what you pay for.

If at any time you have a question about the project, my email is NasserRabadi13@yahoo.com, and my Twitter DMs are always open, @NasserRabadi13.

The book is fully scripted and we have 10 pages penciled and inked and another 10 only penciled.

STRETCH GOALS!

$12,000: the book becomes square bound.

$15,000: a trading card for all physical backers, and an additional one for backers $30+

$20,000: a four page fan art section will be included.

$25,000: Secret Comics stickers and bookmarks for all backers $30+

$30,000: Colors added to all the covers.

 

Other ways to support: Sharing the link out on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and other social media websites, and word of mouth to any horror or comic book fans.

 

Support Nasser's short stories book: https://www.amazon.com/ECLIPSE-THEATER-SUSPENSE...

 

Support Shawn's Etsy store: https://www.etsy.com/market/shawn_langley

story:
With a vast cosmic backdrop framing a fledgling friendship, a dramatic chase and confrontation takes centre stage. This world runs deep with cosmic and ancient mythologies constantly crossing streams, focusing on the titanic struggle between order and chaos !

Below is some sample art from the book.

 

 

Follow the production of the book on Russ's youtube channel - ComicBookBlackBelt.
Live streams and screen captures of the inking process will be available as well as pre-production videos and concept work!

Status at 1st September launch - all pages have pencils and around 30% of the book is inked. 100% lettered and 15% coloured.

We are well on track to hit our schedule of a November print date!

There are 9 tiers to choose from with a mix of original art and prints from some truly awesome guest artists!

We have the "Rob Willis & Renzo Rodrigas" and "Mike Emeritz & Amrit Birdi" A4 prints, poster sets, A4 character sketches and the "4 horsemen" A3 poster - not folded but sent out separately in its own cardboard tube!  

We also have a tier for the collector, with original page art from the book and a one off printed and signed colour canvas of the cover art!


Art and story is by Russ Leach
Russ has a wealth of production experience stretching back over 30 years and has been drawing his whole life. Returning to comic book publishing in 2010 he has since drawn for Marvel, Panini, BBC Worldwide, Hachette, Cartoon Network, Markosia and Aces Weekly. His work includes runs on characters such as Dr Who and Ben 10 as well as two graphic novels for Markosia. "Only Death Can Save Us" is the culmination of a life loving comics!

Scripting by Rik Hoskin
The Dragon Award winner 2018 for Best Graphic Novel, Rik Hoskin is a New York Times bestselling graphic novelist who has written for various popular properties including Superman, Star Wars, Doctor Who, Shrek and Dean Koontz's Frankenstein.  He's also written animated stories for BBC television, and almost 30 novels, making him more than qualified to polish Russ's characters and story line into wonderful dialogue!

Edited by Tim Quinn
Editor Supreme on "Only Death Can Save Us" Tim Quinn, has been a scriptwriter, illustrator and editor on such noted titles as The Beano, The Dandy, Sparky, The Topper, Buster, Whoopee!, Bunty, Jackie, Dr Who Magazine, and Whizzer & Chips before heading Stateside to work for the mighty Marvel Comics Group on the world famous Spider-Man, X-Men and the Incredible Hulk. This is just a fraction of his resume and he is a vital part of making the book feel like comics should feel!

Guest Artists!!
We also have an array of uber-talented guest artists on pinup and colour duties!!

Rob Willis, Renzo Rodrigas, Mike Emeritz, Amrit Birdi, Mike Summers, Chris McAuley​ and Captain Frederick Head 

"Only Death Can Save Us", despite its ominous title, firmly plants itself in the all ages readership audience, like the comics of the Bronze Age, with ex-Marvel editor Tim Quinn guiding the art and story duties of 'Dr Who' and 'Marvel artist' Russ Leach and script writer Rik Hoskin, in a tale that is in many ways a love letter to the way comics used to be!

Never talking down to its audience, the story delivers the same style of Bronze Age action, heart and cosmic drama that inspired its creators!

"The first comic I bought for myself was Captain Britain and within its pages were reprints of Fantastic Four by Lee, Kirby, Buscema and Sinnott as well as support stories like Steranko's Nick Fury Agent of Shield. After that initial thrill, I went on to pick up Spider-Man, The Avengers and so many other amazing Marvel titles as well as some stellar DC books where I found Neal Adams' art, all mixed in with the British grown Starlord and 2000AD. All those influences have stayed with me and shaped the way I want to make my own comics!"
Russ Leach

Below is some of the sample art from Russ's licensed Marvel work

Keystone is the first book in a multi part series that hurls Chrissy and Dee (Death) together on a path through cosmic strangeness, adventure and eternity!”

As a taster we've made the first 8 pages of the book available to read so you can get a real idea of what you'll be getting into!

The characters and story are part of a much bigger, deeper world that we’d love to explore over 3-4 books depending on how well you, the reader, respond. That said, the book can be read as its own individual story much like the comics of the Bronze Age!

You can read the 8 page preview at the top of this page or download a PDF version on the website here (subject to change on final publishing)

Our readers are everything... there are no toxic fans!

If you love comics the way they used to be... a fun, action orientated, hero's journey, then you are in the right place! And while you guys are hungry for stories and lend your support, we'll keep making books!

There are always risks with any endeavour or serious commercial project.
We feel that our combined experience in production and publishing gives us a fair insight into how to put together a project of this type. But no-one is perfect and this is our first crowdfunder! Experience should allow us to spot the snags in advance but...

The unforeseens are just that... unforeseen.

To balance that and inspire your full confidence, the team are determined to make the production of this book as transparent as possible and print is already scheduled in for Mid-November 2020. This means books could be delivered before Christmas although international postage will most likely roll that into January 2021. So our delivery date on all the tiers reflects that.

What we can commit to is that all of the team have track records of the highest standards of professionalism and delivery and that Russ, as the team leader, is ALWAYS available to contact and discuss aspects of the book's production .

You can see how the book has been put together and how the production is getting on by visiting Russ's youtube channel(ComicBookBlackBelt) where he has livestreams and regular screen captures of artwork available. You can also catch him on the usual online haunts Twitter, Facebook, Instagram etc or email him direct at comicbookblackbelt@kre8uk.net.

click here to go to the ComicBookBlackBelt channel

Refunds will be honoured during the initial campaign and 2 weeks after the backer's initial backing during the Indemand phase. After that, all sales are considered final.
